{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"Martha Hunt Told Us Her 4 Favorite Stay-at-Home Basics","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/h7wdLbT80a8/martha-hunt-bulgari-interview","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288738/martha-hunt-bulgari-interview-288738-1597973438373-main.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Frequent flier status has always come with the territory for models in the fashion industry, but lately, it's been fun to take a peek inside their quieter at-home lives. <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/scandinavian-home-decor-trends\" target=\"_blank\">Home tours</a> and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/chic-and-comfy-summer-outfits\" target=\"_blank\">comfy</a> outfits have replaced launch parties and red carpet looks, but that doesn't mean we get any less excited about industry news when it's revealed—and the latest model-brand team-up announcement is no exception. <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=BgLne9tJYZUylyismhubQWJUu9Nlb4XhswYg-xIklVpBrFMk3p0sEi7ksueWxIfS4AiimI5NrCu0n_w\" target=\"_blank\">Martha Hunt</a> has just been named <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=u-PqYjIllQZLkFEig5tQAIwJguNQdL1FNp3IkoIgLmUdE0EX3uCcl2z_-hpXnw\" target=\"_blank\">Bvlgari</a>'s new U.S. ambassador and I'm thinking it's a match made in fashion heaven. Naturally, she <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=2CRWUDpXuhqI6kFXve_4duJm3H0rlSO1NQer7mC4maGnfwMuOFbOMFQ-2rgm6DsfoRIxDdEeRE4\" target=\"_blank\">broke the news on Instagram</a>, and the post quickly went viral.  </p><p>When Bvlgari offered an opportunity to interview Hunt, I jumped at the chance. The first question on my mind? I was curious about the pieces she's been wearing at home recently. \"My fiancé’s oversized button-down because it feels effortlessly chic yet still comfortable,\" she told Who What Wear. \"I love the Bvlgari <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=skktScbaCVTaMVTIW9F7bbWvn-BKmkpBw-hxWxDHjC9QNJkhaCVV0OsHGVgmdEz3utSktqE88G1WcD1i-kBibxPZdLgjCwuerrHfCw\" target=\"_blank\">B.Zero1</a> rings in <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=6yXy590qOLZ9tpYQjC-HbUJHLj2svc4UWbsVN7EjfktgTb5cIWAhTrkHSLJfptoD5KbLUPv_2J2C\" target=\"_blank\">black</a> and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=eXiEjHRkO2MAkzztDj8a7puh5B9NWge7jXN9Cxx28Xk2ySV9L5pTUMbFboYoFA9V4LTsrXjBWJV3\" target=\"_blank\">white ceramic</a> because I’m all about sticking to investment pieces right now! With it being summer, I’m also loving flowy dresses that make you feel like you’re on holiday while being at home. I’ve also been living in a pair of silk boy shorts! They are perfect for hot sticky summer days and go great with a bikini top.\" Amen to that. </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288738/martha-hunt-bulgari-interview-288738-1597971182933-image.800x0uc.png\"><figcaption>On Martha Hunt: Bvlgari Serpenti Tubogas Necklace in 18k Rose Gold With Pavé Diamonds ($65,000); Bvlgari Divas' Dream Earrings ($2900); Bvlgari Serpenti Diamond Blast Shoulder Bag ($3000). I also asked Hunt about what she's looking forward to wearing for fall. She told us she has three specific outfit combos in mind, centered around coats, jeans, and leggings. \"Since fall will probably be about embracing comfortable clothing for at-home meetings, I think we will be seeing more jewelry to dress up casual outfits,\" Hunt said. \"I’m also into the idea of wearing an everyday 'uniform' look because it’s more sustainable—we can forget about the stigma around re-wearing an outfit! Some uniforms for me would be: a strong sandal with a coat because it’s unexpected and the perfect transitional outfit; high-quality leggings with chunky knitwear because it’s functional but chic and knitwear is sexy in a nondescript way; and vintage jeans with a tee, which feels more presentable when accessorized with timeless jewelry, like a Serpenti watch, and a pair of boots.\" Sounds chic to us. Scroll down to see the rest of the new campaign. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288738/martha-hunt-bulgari-interview-288738-1597971180476-image.800x0uc.png\"><figcaption>On Martha Hunt: Bvlgari Serpenti Spiga Watch ($12,900); Bvlgari Divas' Dream Necklace ($2030)</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288738/martha-hunt-bulgari-interview-288738-1597971177168-image.800x0uc.png\"><figcaption>On Martha Hunt: Bvlgari Serpenti Tubogas Watch ($41,200); Bvlgari rings</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img ($5200); Bvlgari Serpenti Tubogas Double Spiral Ring ($7900); Bvlgari Serpenti Viper Band ($5650)</figcaption></figure></p><p><em>Next, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-classic-shoes\" Fall","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/tgP_OTQQn9k/summer-to-fall-staples","description":"<p class=\"p1\">Where would we be without our trusty <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/cheap-fall-basics\" target=\"_blank\">basics</a>? They’re the backbone of our wardrobes and will always solve every fashion dilemma. Our staples look chic when worn together and are ideal for layering with other statement pieces. From <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/cheap-t-shirts-shorts-sandals\" target=\"_blank\">basic tees</a> to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/non-see-through-white-tank-tops\" target=\"_blank\">tank tops</a> and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-black-leggings\" target=\"_blank\">leggings</a> to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-summer-cardigans\" target=\"_blank\">cardigans</a>, you probably already have a decent collection of basics in your closet that you wear on daily rotation. With <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/outdated-fall-trends\" target=\"_blank\">fall</a> just around the corner, today we want to share some super-cool <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/simple-fall-outfit-ideas-2019\" target=\"_blank\">autumn outfit ideas</a> that you can easily assemble with the basics you already own. Scroll below for plenty of sartorial inspiration along with some excellent shopping picks should you need to update your current staples.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597948828653-main.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Take your basic white tee into the fall season by pairing it with similar neutral hues to add instant polish to the staple. White and ivory work surprisingly well together so try styling your tee with off-white wide-leg pants or jeans and finish the look with a tan trench, beige boots, and gold jewelry.`</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597961561003-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597961990816-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597962246014-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597949488809-main.1080x1347uc.jpg\"><figcaption>A white button-down is a year-round staple which we've been styling with everything from shorts to sweats and over our bikinis throughout summer. For fall, try layering the staple over a black turtleneck and under an oversize wool blazer. Keep the look chic by tucking it into slim black jeans. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img To transition the basic easily into fall simply swap out your shorts for cool high-waisted pants cinched at the waist with a belt. Finish the look with a lightweight raincoat—perfect for those days when it's not too hot and not too cold.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597966989937-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597967204072-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597967443422-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597967290458-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288720/summer-to-fall-staples-288720-1597951808048-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>You can throw a classic trench coat over anything and it will look ten times chicer in our book. href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/what-to-wear-with-shorts\" target=\"_blank\">shorts</a> sometimes? Honestly, who needs a thick waistband when you can wear a breezy, comfortable dress? I don't consider myself a big dress wearer, but it never fails that every time June rolls around, I suddenly become someone who wears <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/summer-dresses-with-sleeves\" target=\"_blank\">dresses</a> (at least a few times a month, that is). But since summer dress outfits are so very simple, the key to a <em>great</em> summer dress outfit is the shoes you wear with it. That's where I come in.</p><p>While you could just grab your <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-casual-dress-trends\" target=\"_blank\">casual dress</a> of choice and throw on the first pair of summer shoes you see, you'd be just fine, but there are many, many different types of summer shoes and many, many different types of casual summer dresses to wear with them, so I'm here to provide a little guidance in case you happen to love any of the 13 beautiful dresses featured below. 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"Artists' Choice: 16 Brands Black Beauty Experts Always Keep in Their Kits","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/B9pwzjCFKPg/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034015434-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>August is National Black Business Month, and while we love celebrating <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/black-history-month-fashion-industry\" target=\"_blank\">our favorite Black artists</a> and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/black-owned-beauty-brands\" target=\"_blank\">Black-owned beauty brands</a> all 365 days of the year, we felt it was an especially opportune time to shine a spotlight on some of the beauty industry's best artistic talent and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/black-owned-beauty-retailers\" target=\"_blank\">the Black-owned businesses and products</a> they love, consistently use, and recommend to friends, family, A-list clients, and, of course, you! </p><p>Below, we asked leading hairstylists and makeup artists (who regularly work with the glamorous likes of Tracee Ellis Ross, Naomi Campbell, Gabrielle Union, Laverne Cox, and so many more) which Black-owned brands and formulas we'd regularly find tucked into their product kits, showers, and high-standard beauty regimens. Keep scrolling! Our panel of experts are sharing 16 Black-owned beauty brands you can support this month in honor of National Black Business Month and always. </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034024249-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Creamy and dreamy, the Dual Skin Creme Foundationis a must whenever I create a red carpet beauty look. I discovered this product when I wandered into the AJ Crimson atelier during my first award show season in Los Angeles back in 2016. The dapper AJ personally introduced me to this foundation, and I've been hooked ever since. The buildable, beeswax-based formula is rich, luminous, and photographs like a dream when you set it with your favorite powder.\" — Deja \"The Lady Deja\" Smith, celebrity makeup artist</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034029740-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I'm also obsessed with the hours-long wear of his S+M Matte Liquid Lipstick. This particular formulation of liquid lipstick is comfortable and has the perfect-size applicator for full lips like mine. Everyone should have the signature red, Ruby Who?\" — Smith</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034036237-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Pat McGrath Labs is really tailored to the needs of working makeup artists. As a young devotee of Fashion Television, a touchstone of my passion for beauty was watching the backstage interviews from beautiful Black Motha Pat McGrath. Fast-forward to the launch of her brand, and I couldn't have been any happier with the luxe experience of her packaging and products. The MatteTrance Lipstickwas the first to catch my attention with its creamy, yet opaque, formulation.\" — Smith</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034042457-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"The intensely pigmented shades inside this palette are easy to manipulate with your fingers or a brush, wet or dry, to achieve your desired attention-grabbing gaze.\" — Smith</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034048056-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"My newest must-have item, however, is the FetishEyes Lengthening Mascarabecause the super-black pigment easily builds from defined, ultra-long length to a thick and voluminous effect that still manages to maintain lash separation coat after coat. I can't wait to try her newest extreme black mascara, Dark Star Voluminizeing Mascara.\" — Smith</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034071166-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034078850-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Pattern's products are super, super thick, and they feel luxurious in their consistency, which is excellent for penetrating curls. I always recommend using the Hydration Shampoo and the Intensive Conditioner. I use the Hydration Shampoo for really dry, brittle, and damaged curls. Then, for ultra-hydration and repair, I follow with the Intensive Conditioner under heat or steam to open the cuticles, which helps deposit all of the nutrients.\" — Marcia Hamilton, celebrity hairstylist</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034086739-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I love this brand because of its high performance, brand messaging, and oversized packaging. AND of course, it was created by my beloved Tracee Ellis Ross, whose glamour and beauty regimens have been an inspiration to most of us. This Edge Control is one of my favorite products—it's a maximum-hold product, but it’s not cakey, which is very important when doing sleek looks or even styling baby hair.\" — Nai'vasha, celebrity hairstylist</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034105503-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I love this Strong Hold Gel because I can create so many refined looks, and it never flakes. That’s really tough to find when using strong gels.\" — Nai'vasha</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034102823-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Who better to go to for all things curls than Tracee Ellis Ross? Aptly named, this brand is the best curly hair product on the market that really brings out and enhances my natural curl pattern. Pattern Beauty products are moisturizing and provide excellent curl separation and definition, so my natural curl pattern really shines. I use the Curl Gel immediately after I wash my hair while it’s still damp. I gently scrunch it into my curls so I don’t disturb the texture. Then I flip upside down and diffuse my hair until it's halfway dry.  The curl gel is my go-to because it provides all-day bounce!\" — Tasha Reiko Brown, celebrity makeup artist</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034110808-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"For years, I've used and loved this Leave-In Conditioner. It’s always consistent, and it works great on natural curls as well as curly hair extensions.\" — Hamilton</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034117346-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I've recently started using the Conditioning Cleansing Co-Wash on my own hair, and it's excellent. My hair feels soft but not filmy or sticky.\" — Hamilton</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034122316-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Everything from Mielle Organics smells yummy and has tons of natural organic ingredients like sunflower seed oil, cocoa seed butter, rice bran water, and more. I always recommend the Mongongo Oil Protein-Free Hydrating Conditioner to restore shine to curly hair that has been overly heat styled.\" — Hamilton</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034128259-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"The Rice Water Clay Masque is amazing for detoxifying and removing impurities from the hair while infusing moisture.\" — Hamilton</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034136693-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I love Flawless by Gabrielle Union. Not only am I a fan of the products, but I’m also co-owner. Gabrielle and I created the line for textured-hair consumers. We have 12 products, including a Hydrating Detangling Hair Shampoo, Hydrating Co-Wash Cleansing Hair Conditioner, and more.\" — Larry Sims, celebrity hairstylist</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034140482-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I started as a salon stylist, and one of the leading brands in that setting is Design Essentials. They are innovative and smart with their product choices, and they're really a stylist's brand. The Compositions Foaming Lotion is a kit favorite for me because I can set any style and texture using this foam. It’s flake-free and residue-free. My roller sets and twist-outs result in a shiny finish.\" — Nai'vasha</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034146979-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I love Design Essentials because it is a complete haircare line. They have everything one could possibly need. They do not discriminate when it comes to texture, and there is something for everyone. I incorporate the brand into my clients' haircare routine by starting them off with the shampoo and deep-conditioning masques. Then, once they see how incredible their hair feels afterward, I slowly work the styling products in to help make my job as a hairstylist easier.\" — Ro Morgan, celebrity hairstylist</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034152724-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"This is a vitamin A and C serum that improves skin’s clarity and texture while also diminishing blemishes and, most importantly, increasing decongestion of pores. And it smells divine!\" — Autumn Moultrie, celebrity makeup artist</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034158233-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"This is a no-brainer for brown skin. It smells good, blends in easily, and it is affordable.\" — Moultrie</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034165000-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"With 2.2% encapsulated retinol, this serum boosts collagen production and improves cell turnover. It's excellent for diminishing fine lines, wrinkles, and acne scars. It also has 2% lactic acid, which brightens dull skin. It's a game changer.\" — Moultrie</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034170711-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Unlike any other face scrub I have ever used, this face polish leaves your skin feeling like a baby’s bottom immediately. It has a combination of coffee beans from Kenya and sugar, and it is great for people who shy away from serums and want a physical scrub. This hero product is truly amazing. My husband steals this product from me and keeps it in his shower to use every other day.\" — Moultrie</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034182122-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"As a makeup artist, I spend the most time perfecting my canvas so I can use as little product as possible. Ingredients matter, and Pholk has delicious, time-tested, tried-and-true formulas. I cleanse every day with the Daily Detox Face Wash, and then I treat myself weekly to the GlowUp Mask With Apple + Hibiscus.\" — Reiko Brown</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034187651-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"When my skin is looking a little dull during colder months, I use the H2Oil Night Treatment Hemp x Hibiscus Night Oil along with the GlowUp Mask to hydrate overnight so I wake up to plump, moisturized skin.\" — Reiko Brown</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034194724-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I love color—not an abundance of it—but a strong wash of 'you can't miss it' color on a face with clean skin is such a modern and elegant beauty look that has a spark of personality. Juvia's Place eye shadow palettes give me rich, bold, bright, quirky, and traditional primary colors that are creamy to apply and packed with pigment, so a little goes a long way. The creamy texture blends out the edges seamlessly onto lids so I can get a diffused wash of color with barely any need to blend.\" — Reiko Brown </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034198916-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"To softly pair with bright lids, Juiva's Place also has the most gorgeous chocolate nude lipstick collection for deeper skin tones that give a hint of warmth while still being a true nude. I keep her palettes and lipsticks in heavy rotation in my kit.\" — Reiko Brown</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034205506-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I love Danessa Myricks Beauty because her products are so versatile. One of my favorites is this beautiful pigmented cream called Colorfix 24-Hour Ceram Color. You can use it on the entire face, for eye shadow, lipstick, blush, and contour. Most importantly, however, it does not move! This also means that you need to work fast, but once it dries, its set for good. That kind of security in a product is priceless when you send your clients on the red carpet. It comes in small-squeeze tubes, which is perfect because you don’t risk cross-contamination by dipping any tools inside. This is really important when you're trying to keep your kit as clean as possible.\" — Jessica Smalls, celebrity makeup artist</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034210993-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I love using the Love & Light Beauty Oils when I skin-prep on myself and my clients. I place a couple of drops into a serum and apply it to all the high points of the complexion like the cheekbone, brow bone, Cupid's bow, and the bridge of the nose. It creates a radiant glow from within, with and without foundation, for a really beautiful yet natural look.\" — Smalls</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034215945-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Finding suitable grooming products for my Black male clients was always a struggle until I came across Scotch Porter. I love their products and their approach to masculine skincare, as well as healthy beard care. I appreciate that the products aren’t greasy or overly fragranced, which is important when grooming men. A favorite product is their Moisture Defend Face Lotion. It hydrates the skin while leaving a soft matte finish, which is perfect because shiny, greasy skin is a no-no for my clients who are on camera or for my fiancé when I’m making him take a million selfies.\" — Smalls</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034219329-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"They also have a Conditioning Beard Balm that’s the bomb! I rub about a dime- to a quarter-size amount in the palms of my hands and massage it into the beard. It makes the beard hair, which is often dry and coarse, feel really soft and manageable while treating the skin underneath to help keep ingrown hairs at bay. When we have enough time, I will part the beard with a comb and apply a thin layer of the balm directly to the skin for a deep-conditioning treatment. Or I just tell my clients to do this at home twice a week!\" — Smalls</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288733/black-owned-hair-makeup-skincare-products-288733-1598034227269-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I love the Detangling Brush by Felicia Leatherwood. It's amazing because it helps detangle even the tightest curls. This product is easy to work into my clients' haircare routine, and I always recommend they use the detangling brush once they apply their conditioner and leave-in conditioner. After my clients have seen the effortless glide of the brush and how it evenly distributes product throughout their hair, they are hooked!\" — Morgan. 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"How to Find the Best Denim Inseam for Your Height","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/NHrYyqVuWLU/best-inseam-length-jeans","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1585088412319-image.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>While it would be lovely if every pair of jeans we acquired had the perfect <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-jeans-for-women-over-40\" target=\"_blank\">inseam length</a>, it's hardly ever the case, as we know from experience. Most <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-jean-trends\" target=\"_blank\">jeans</a> made for women come in <em>one</em> inseam length, which adds to the unlikelihood that they'll work for bodies of any height, especially when we add <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/shoes-to-wear-with-jeans\" target=\"_blank\">different shoe styles</a> into the equation. That said, there are different things we can keep in mind when <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-summer-jeans\" target=\"_blank\">shopping for denim</a> and visiting the tailor, and we found just the professional to boil it all down for us.</p><p>Katya Torres is the owner of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=UyRbL5eKNwUrCbkGt3O7eRgvOehrH8CHh4_xFLVNnCrOD7SKk8LaomoUX0w35HpT1n8t\" target=\"_blank\">Denim Surgeon</a>, the New York City-based denim-tailoring experts that distress, repair, and perfect the fit of any pair of jeans that come their way. We consulted Torres on the subject of the best length for both shorter women and taller women, and her tips are sure to clear up any questions you may have about denim inseams. While having an expert opinion is always a good idea, we do want to remind you that style is individual and should be tackled however you please. We are just here to guide you when you're craving some support.</p><p>Read on to see what Torres recommends when it comes to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/cute-outfits-with-jeans\" target=\"_blank\">denim lengths, styles, and tailoring advice</a>, and shop the best jeans for shorter and taller women.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/-227025-1497552223605-image.800x0uc.gif\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"For shorter-than-average women such as myself (I'm 5'2\"), avoid very baggy and boxy-cut jeans,\" Torres suggests. \"Bell-bottoms are okay if you only plan on wearing them with (very) high heels or wedges that are completely covered by the jeans' hem. It's a great optical illusion. Slim-fitting (tapered) or straight-leg jeans are flattering for shorter women, whether they're cropped, ankle, or standard length. We recommend an inseam no less than 21 inches. Avoid jeans that are too long, as they create a huge break (also known as stacking) and look sloppy. A proper hem on jeans is crucial to a shorter or petite woman. Raw-edge hems also look great, but always keep in mind that proper length is key.\"</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597085685375-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597085875741-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597085937423-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1562187639069-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086023107-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1562188059342-main.1280x1920uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1585624777736-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086150577-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086231869-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086270816-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>For taller women, Torres says, \"Anything goes, really. High-waisted jeans look great, whether they're slim and long or relaxed and cropped. From personal experience fitting tall women, jean length is typically a matter of personal preference and varies on the type of footwear that you plan to wear. But the rule of thumb is we go with the longest possible inseam if the client seeks a longer-looking leg. A shorter inseam (e.g., cropped or ankle length) will break up the vertical-denim flow and legs won't appear to be as long.\"</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086360054-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086386977-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086446769-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086514320-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086562472-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086611166-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086863431-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086904605-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/227025/best-inseam-length-jeans-227025-1597086993649-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"Women Over 40 Know These Styling Tricks Will Make an Outfit More Fashionable","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/asmdbzggha0/fashion-tips-over-40","description":"<p>We follow a range of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fashion-over-40\" target=\"_blank\">over-40 influencers</a>, in particular, for their seasoned sartorial point of view. Of course, age has absolutely nothing to do with what you should or shouldn't wear, but this set just <em>gets it</em> with their experience over the years fine-tuning a wardrobe. In fact, we specifically turn to women over 40 for unique styling inspiration.</p><p>On that note, we recently noticed quite the interesting style trick from one of our <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/renata-jazdzyk-vens-wife-style\" target=\"_blank\">favorite follows</a>, Renia Jaz behind <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=83PkeMySzypxmuIw2RleCtnE9rQLxn-7RCQWEq5Siic3Y27FWdslInUobIe3DDPh0-dUSwcdrA0\" target=\"_blank\">@venswifestyle</a>. For <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=6X5OHKPTU0TLISqIXK2CODDwnGK_G38HyyxwI71ZWX4pUdycT_o6U5XPgBCI5nJ7_zwZpNJg0hU\" target=\"_blank\">this outfit</a>, rather than buying an asymmetric tank, she actually used one of her <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=kjeCNRlAG3HQCAqK7qlArN8jNOd-0CsFQunxFPNoqQ7D9Lb5LmW5-rpm8d_PsVLIUzRZVpElC0K2rrlo-4cWjf-5M4CPg_M-EI3kPAeeWc0FzPJqEvTssVssgUdnhjMGlpfFvFNhj4OQXp6DzYGxECcBIAThb90euzb6-983gVGS_H0UquDbnRkfrSszQGBXPYWQnA\" target=\"_blank\">classic H&M tanks</a> and moved the straps over her head to create her own asymmetric top. Yep, a genius trick to take the outfit to the next level.</p><p>With all that said, we thought we'd showcase more of this look below, along with other interesting <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/summer-fashion-tips\" target=\"_blank\">styling tricks</a> we're noting from some of our other favorite over-40 fashion people. Keep scrolling for a few tips that could make you outfit that more fashionable. And if you're in the mood to shop, you'll also discover some of the chic pieces these influencers love as well.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287895/fashion-tips-over-40-287895-1592994906669-image.1080x1349uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The trick: Pull one of the straps of your classic tank over your head and place it near the other strap. This will create the illusion of a trendy asymmetric top.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img top.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img Wardrobe","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/mQ4iLuKYIsU/fall-basics-capsule-wardrobe","description":"<p><a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/summer-basics-wardrobe\" target=\"_blank\">Basics</a> are often considered the backbones of a wardrobe thanks to their inherently versatile nature. As a result, we typically plan our seasonal wardrobes around said simple staples. For fall specifically, there’s an edit of a few specific basics that we, as fashion editors, unanimously think reign supreme to act as the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-capsule-wardrobe\" target=\"_blank\">foundational pieces</a> in particularly forward looks. Basically, this curation of items could be mixed and matched with other trend-driven pieces to formulate modern and of-the-moment autumn silhouettes. </p><p>Intrigued? Below you'll find the ultimate seven-piece basics wardrobe, which includes everything from timeless outerwear cuts to comfortable separates. We're also showcasing outfit inspiration to highlight said basics in action.</p><p>Keep scrolling for more. Oh, and if you’re shopping at the moment, you’ll also uncover coordinating picks for each as well.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597698100284-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><strong><a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fashion-and-beauty-items-for-video-calls\" target=\"_blank\">Most Wanted</a></strong> <em>is a weekly series in which one Who What Wear team member or friend of the brand will share the top 25 fashion and beauty finds on their current wish list</em></p><p>Sartorially speaking, I'm actually a bit excited that the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-shopping-online\" target=\"_blank\">first day of fall</a> is about a month away. After all, fall brings with it that offering of cozy style picks with comfortable sweaters, A+ denim cuts, and cute knit dresses reigning supreme. In fact, many top-notch early-fall items have already begun to hit the new arrivals sections at some of my favorite shops.</p><p>Naturally, I thought I’d share with you some of the standouts that have caught me eye recently. Given that I personally live in <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-fall-clothing-basics\" target=\"_blank\">basics</a>, I wanted to zero-in on those particularly <em>trendy basics</em> that are elevated and forward yet highly versatile in that they can easily be mixed and matched with other simple items. Basically, I think the pieces in question could actually have the potential to make your wardrobe all the chicer. Intrigued? Keep scrolling to uncover my edit of 25 next-level fall basics. You may just find a few of your new seasonal go-tos.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597699096629-product.1500x2098uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Yes, knit vests are still happening—toss this neutral pick over any basic top for an elevated vibe.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597698445766-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>It's the fit and current-feeling utility vibe that makes this re-worked trench coat so appealing.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597850616780-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This slouchy cardigan is chic enough as is, but the rhinestone buttons take it to the next level.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597703854394-product.2400x3200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This upgraded blazer will team flawlessly with everything from jeans to trousers.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597702678339-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The denim silhouette fashion girls adore.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597700705757-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The ruching combined with the bordeaux hue is just gorgeous. This can basically go with every outfit.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597702130783-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>A+ for these—as comfy as joggers with the elastic waist and stretch, but quite polished as well.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597699570800-product.962x1256uc.png\"><figcaption>The silhouette here is anything but basic, but it's still incredibly versatile.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597699736934-main.2000x3000uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The leather-look trend continues to hold strong. So into the tie detail at the front.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597700548601-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Black booties that are incredibly forward with the high upper and squared-off toe.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288669/fall-fashion-items-288669-1597698890241-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Is it a shirt? 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"I Asked a Celebrity Stylist What to Buy and What to Skip This Fall","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/xlcagvnZOOM/fall-style-guide","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597760761167-image.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Everyone you speak to will have their own opinion on what’s worth buying, skipping, wearing, and holding off on for the coming season. I know <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-basics\" target=\"_blank\">I have some thoughts</a>—in fact, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-sweater-trends\" target=\"_blank\">so many</a>—as do <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-shopping-online\" target=\"_blank\">my fellow editors </a>and countless other <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-fashion-for-women-over-60\" target=\"_blank\">fashion insiders</a>. However, when I thought about who my ideal expert would be to press on the matter of what’s worth snagging for the coming months, I couldn’t think of anyone more well-informed than a celebrity stylist. After all, they’re not just responsible for dressing stars and It girls according to what’s cool, but they’re also often the ones who <em>decide </em>what the next must-have basic or trending item will be before it's even a thing.</p><p>With that in mind, I ventured to tap <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=2WTXE_uGYv3eLZ4goChj2hKrtdO_RZ7m3MFnU9ylmN7IyGOvYbh9CN4nEfOchRms7r4JKFbZkVXp2g\">Scot Louie</a>—stylist to Kehlani, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/hustlers-keke-palmer\">Keke Palmer</a>, Karrueche Tran, and more plus an enviable dresser in his own right—to tell me just what I was itching to know. Luckily for all of us, he not only obliged but delivered. To read about Louie’s purchasing dos and don’ts for fall and to shop his list of must-have items along the way, simply continue scrolling.  </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597760761656-image.1200x1500uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597760760619-image.1200x1500uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"After all, you’ve been quarantined for months in sweats.\"</p><p>\"Let’s leave the chunky sneakers in the back of the closet.\"</p><p>\"Smart styling is so much more appealing.\"</p><p>\"While fluorescents had a fun run, opt for neutrals this season. Timeless shopping is where the world is going, be sustainable.\"</p><p>\"Tiny useless bags are great for the obligatory Instagram post, but in reality, we need something sizable and practical. I’d like to fit more than a Tic Tac in my purse.\"</p><p>\"As 'life after quarantine' slowly starts to happen for most states, date night will become a possibility again. Day-to-night dresses are the perfect essential.\"</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761431428-main.920x1333uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597762358944-main.960x1450uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597762579748-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597762358749-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597762393973-main.800x0uc.png\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"A basic but necessary staple to refresh in your closet every so often. I love the way brands are reimagining the white T-shirt with different cuts and silhouettes.\"</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597764113593-main.2000x2514uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761530214-main.2000x2769uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597762706939-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761535560-main.2000x2285uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597762825345-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"A good boot is a must-have for the seasonal transition! I’m partial to a riding boot—investing in a good riding boot that can last you for seasons to come.\"</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761749177-main.2000x3001uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761749429-main.1598x2560uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763104862-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761749532-main.1598x2560uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763085345-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"A gold hoop is a staple across my female clients. Gold hoops bring added interest to any outfit whether dressed up or down. Finding the right size is essential, not too big and not too small.\"</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761845242-main.2000x2353uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763380759-main.1500x1617uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763386868-main.1660x2118uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761849520-main.824x935uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763463896-main.1128x1506uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"Bodysuits have too been reimagined. Ditch the idea of a bodysuit being athletic or super casual. Bodysuits are updated with interesting fits and necklines for a figure-grazing sleek look.\"</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761905614-main.1598x2560uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img f0708.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763386868-main.1660x2118uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn25@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-23-731_aba27a51b5279c51.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761849520-main.824x935uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn5@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-14-17-765_98829bfe16c821f2.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763463896-main.1128x1506uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn57@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-11-850_882993028f6aa9fb.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761905614-main.1598x2560uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn51@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-14-03-278_666cfb8b0b2861ff.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763966973-main.1128x1881uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn33@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-22-365_91ffc14449ce98db.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597763766618-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn7@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-14-07-678_ae5200cc1da1160f.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597764039972-main.960x1450uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn41@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-14-12-811_dd3ba3e74fc7e306.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288677/fall-style-guide-288677-1597761905803-main.1598x2560uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn8@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-14-06-811_a9a958598db498d3.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/xlcagvnZOOM":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn77@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-14-259_f6a367f9accbae34.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598321581913},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"French Girls Laugh Every Time Americans Wear These 3 Things","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/2MBrgp4G9Ck/difference-between-french-and-american-style","description":"<p>There's no denying the fact that Americans are obsessed with <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/french-fashion-brands\" target=\"_blank\">French-girl style</a>. As we've discussed pretty tirelessly, Parisian women dress in a way that, for whatever reason, American girls aspire to achieve. Normally, we ask our favorite French girls all about the items they're buying, wearing, loving, etc., so that we can all go off and make our purchases accordingly, but this time we wanted to switch it up. Intrigued yet?</p><p>We reached out to a handful of our <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/french-style-fashion-rules-2014\" target=\"_blank\">favorite French women</a> and asked them what, if anything, it is about American style that makes them laugh. I tried guessing before I asked them the daunting question, but my answers were nowhere close to what they had to say. When it comes to the differences between American and French style, these Parisian ladies have quite a few things to say. Ahead, find out what French girls said they find funny about American style. </p><p>“Sometimes I am a bit surprised by the ‘more is more’ party dress code, for example. I mean shiny makeup, hair done, glitter dress, high heels. I think it's silly—just not at all what I used to do.” — <em>Chloé Harrouche</em></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634643216-image.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: If your dress has a festive adornment like feathers or crystals, opt for some more subdued shoes to let the real party pieces shine. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634643300-image.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: However, if you want to go all out the French way, make sure to choose pieces that are neutral in color and unique in silhouette, like these crystal-fringe pants.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634643681-image.1080x880uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Make an all-black party look pop with sparkly accessories.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441088349-main.960x1450uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441037676-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441120742-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>“From my years living in New York, I remember lots of girls wearing at night super-mini and tight dresses with high platform shoes. The girls were a little over the top.” <em>— Géraldine Boublil</em></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634644167-image.1080x1091uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Even the simplest of black dresses can be made more interesting with the addition of statement shoes.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634644314-image.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Tone down a skirt that’s really “extra” with unusual counterparts like cowboy boots and slim sunnies.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634644428-image.1080x1219uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Instead of a minidress and platforms, try a velvet suit and manageable pumps.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1582921261780-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441394417-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441212706-main.1001x1400uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>“I definitely would say leggings. In L.A., it looks like all the girls are going to the sports hall.” — <em>AnneLaure Mais Moreau</em></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634645032-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Pair a bold-colored top with leopard pants for a truly trendy look. You’ll look cool with minimal effort.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634642675-image.1080x1349uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Wearing plaid pants? Opt for a contrasting plaid accessory to make your look feel more forward and less dated.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634643092-image.1080x1349uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Toughen up preppy plaid trousers with a graphic T-shirt.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1582921625415-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441297705-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441302530-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>“Something that I’ve seen a lot on American girls is heels! They wear heels every day, everywhere, while in France, we wear sneakers—even at the office.” <em>— Kenza Sadoun-el Glaoui</em></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634643903-image.1080x1349uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Make your timeless wardrobe staples feel fresh by way of chunkier sneakers.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634643514-image.1080x1349uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Even your work trousers can feel more exciting with quirky last-minute additions like colorful sneakers and a shiny puffer.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634644014-image.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: Instead of reaching for your tried-and-true pumps when rushing to get to the office, slip into a sleek pair of sneakers.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1582922010950-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1574257691216-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1582922011036-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>“I actually find that most Americans are now trying to dress more European. But I do think super-high heels are silly. Less is always more in my opinion.” <em>— Christina Caradona</em></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634644740-image.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: It’s not the heel height that will make your outfit a knockout; it’s the heel shape. This season, opt for square toes and low block heels.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634644655-image.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: White shoes will always make you look polished, no matter how low the heel.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634644897-image.1080x1349uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Tip: And if heels aren’t your thing, this photo is proof that you can still look sleek sans heels, even while wearing sneakers. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441414363-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441420351-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441486145-main.2000x3000uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Up next: British Women Politely Chuckle Every Time Americans Wear These 4 Items. einc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1544634644897-image.1080x1349uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn3@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-14-07-788_8a0cec09023aa3ce.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441414363-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn10@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-31-230_ab11ea80ddba603e.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441420351-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn71@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-14-25-830_9f14ee678b360ccf.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/274940/difference-between-french-and-american-style-274940-1597441486145-main.2000x3000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn45@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-18-469_6847a1980aed7948.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/2MBrgp4G9Ck":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn72@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-50-765_839411b525f28c5e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598321581863},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"Alexa Chung’s Hairdresser Just Told Me the Best Haircut for My Face Shape","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/6FZveZBGCW8/best-haircut-for-long-face","description":"<p>Do you know what kind of face shape you have? I think we all have our own ideas of what we think we look like in the mirror. But Narcissus himself probably couldn't identify what kind of face shape he had. Because for years (all 35 of them) I'd convinced myself that I had a round face. This is partly due to having quite full cheeks, I’m sure, but when I spoke to George Northwood, owner of the eponymous salon and hairdresser to oh, just <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/alexa-chung-work-from-home-outfits\" target=\"_blank\">Alexa Chung</a>, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/rosie-huntington-whiteley-skincare-routine\" target=\"_blank\">Rosie Hungtington-Whiteley</a> and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/meghan-markle-shorts-sneakers-face-mask\" target=\"_blank\">Meghan Markle</a>, he said I had a long/oval-shaped face. Why does this matter? Well, for six months I hadn't had a haircut and I wanted to know which haircut was the best for my face shape. I asked George to chat with me about how I should get it cut because he’s a legend in his industry. </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288453/best-haircut-for-long-face-288453-1596462610680-image.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption>George Northwood and Elinor Block in a Zoom call. Days before I went for the cut, I spoke to George over Zoom. I quickly gave him the facts: I hadn’t had my haircut for over six months, I wanted to go short, but how short could I go? The reason for the short hair question was because I didn’t know when I’d have another chance of getting my haircut (hello, second wave) and I couldn’t face my hair getting so long again.  “Post-lockdown, everyone is desperate for a big change,” says George. “To get the look you’re after, you need to consider what you want to achieve and think about the different proportions.” . For me, George suggested that I can go short and even take it up to my jawline if I want, as I’ve got a longer face than I realise. So, by cutting the length, it won’t make my face look too round (as I personally didn’t want it to). Equally, he says, “If you don’t want anymore width to your face [if your face is round] then don’t go for a shorter bob and keep it long as that will help elongate your face.” . Ultimately, I learn that it’s all about working out what look you want to go for and then working out the length and shape from there. George also told me about hard and soft features, which can also impact the length of your hair and how short you go. For example, the beautiful Sarah Jessica Parker has a long face but she has arguably harder features so she opts for longer, wavier hair to soften her features. Whereas Halle Berry has gorgeous soft features and suits a really short crop.  He also goes by the rule of “the more height on top you have and the skinnier the hair the thinner the face will look,” he says. There are also features that people might want to make a priority, so they might opt for a grown-out fringe to highlight cheekbones.  Below, you can see my before and after looks, then keep scrolling to see my favourite haircare products.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288453/best-haircut-for-long-face-288453-1597856915906-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>As you can see, this is over my shoulders. My hair was also incredibly full and harder to style—bear in mind this is after it has been blow-dried and straightened so it’s much harder to tame when curly. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288453/best-haircut-for-long-face-288453-1597857182581-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288453/best-haircut-for-long-face-288453-1597856831455-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The shorter look. A better option for me as it doesn’t make my face look too round (or to me it doesn’t) and I get all that weight lifted off. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288784/best-haircut-for-long-face-288784-1598309912099-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This is a perfect natural remedy for anyone dealing with dandruff and a dry scalp.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288453/best-haircut-for-long-face-288453-1597857726907-main.2000x3001uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Curly-haired gals have long been obsessed with this moisturizing shampoo.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288784/best-haircut-for-long-face-288784-1598310743868-main.800x0uc.png\"><figcaption>This does everything you'd want a conditioner to do: moisturize without weighing down.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288784/best-haircut-for-long-face-288784-1598312520421-main.1000x1308uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This shampoo boasts macadamia oil to moisturize your hair and smooth frizz. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288784/best-haircut-for-long-face-288784-1598311161530-main.1962x2459uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This mask is such a joy to use once or twice a week. After you rinse it out, it feels like you've left the salon. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288784/best-haircut-for-long-face-288784-1598311357693-main.1127x1500uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Not only does it leave your hair smelling amazing, but it also looks incredibly chic in your bathroom. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288784/best-haircut-for-long-face-288784-1598312471559-main.1000x1253uc.gif\"><figcaption>What can cilantro do for your shampoo? It gives it a fresh, crisp natural scent that reviewers love.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img protectant. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288784/best-haircut-for-long-face-288784-1598312194277-main.800x0uc.png\"><figcaption>If you color treat barley to moisturize naturally. </figcaption></figure></p><p><em>Next up, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/anti-aging-products/\" target=\"_blank\">this 89-year-old looks 25 years younger–here
