sale find is good enough on its own, the experience is only made better when you already have confirmation that a piece is as great as it appears to be online—before even ordering it. Since aiming to please is pretty much our number one order of business over here, today, I’ve got quite the roundup for you.</p><p>In honor of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/nordstrom-anniversary-sale-2020\" target=\"_blank\">Nordstrom’s highly anticipated Anniversary Sale</a> which, if you didn’t know, is going on now, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-shopping-online\" target=\"_blank\">I tapped team Who Who What Wear</a> for the on-sale items that they actually own and are obsessed with. From activewear to beauty products to some <em>miscellaneous</em> favorites, I don’t want to brag but also can’t help but admit that we seriously delivered across many categories and price points. To see, read about, and shop all 25of our picks before they’re gone, simply keep scrolling.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288712/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-finds-2020-288712-1597936506392-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"This Nike sports bra is my absolute favorite for whenever I work out. Now I'll need to stock up on more colors.\"—Kristen Nichols, senior editor</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288712/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-finds-2020-288712-1597936945544-main.1660x2020uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I pretty much buy all of my Natori bras from the Nordstrom Anniversary sale, as it's rare to find them this cheap elsewhere. Kidding - but not really. I swear by this cult-classic fragrance in cooler months, so I was pleasantly surprised to see it available in this long-lasting antiperspirant form for such a great price. It will pair perfectly with a new fall sweater, too.\"—Drew Elovitz, director of content strategy. \"It might sound weird to be obsessed with a deodorant, but that's how I feel about the Donna Karan one. I first tried it because of its cult following and it lives up to all of the hype. It's practically clinical strength and has an amazing (but subtle) floral scent. While the price is steeper than a drugstore find, I promise it's worth it.\"—Kristen Nichols, senior editor</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288712/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-finds-2020-288712-1597939406425-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I have a few curling irons, but this wide-barreled one from T3 is the one I use the most because it creates the most natural-looking soft waves.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288712/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-finds-2020-288712-1597937277749-main.1660x2036uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I rotate between Le Labo's iconic Santal 33 fragrance and its lesser-known but favorite of mine, Another 13. This mindless-yet-heartwarming activity (okay, plus a few <a href=\"https://thethirty.whowhatwear.com/essential-oils-guidehttps://thethirty.whowhatwear.com/beginner-yoga-sequences\" target=\"_blank\">yoga stretches</a> and <a href=\"https://thethirty.whowhatwear.com/essential-oils-guide\" target=\"_blank\">essential oils</a>) helped me relax, clear my head, and genuinely appreciate the unconditional love that comes from caring for an animal. </p><p>Whether or not you have a pet at home to keep you company, it's probably safe to say that cute animals are something everyone on the internet enjoys now and again. 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"7 Madewell Basics I've Been Buying For Years","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/X4NrHlJZ848/madewell-basics","description":"<p>I remember the very first time I ever bought anything from <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=-iR5IxT1W9EMvstD1qHBw68svyLlhZSqi4JJQJfB4K__29bDwQrwzrpyF2Vs3KRbS2NNzbbv6fDvTrxKz0bNfa9wTQvSvXW3HlrB5VaO7cGWArpO54SNNkbj\" target=\"_blank\">Madewell</a>. It was 10 or 11 years ago and I had just gotten my bonus from my first full-time \"office\" job. When I left work for the day, I drove straight to the Century City Mall in L.A. and bought a sparkly (subtly) navy blue double-breasted blazer. I wore it dozens of times over the years and I still own it. My repeated use of the blazer and my reluctance to part with it is a testament to just how well <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-madewell-items\" target=\"_blank\">Madewell</a> does special <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/practical-wardrobe-staples\" target=\"_blank\">basics</a>.</p><p>I've continued to shop at Madewell over the years, and I have plenty of outfit photos to prove it, as you'll see below. Something I've noticed about my Madewell purchases is that I always gravitate toward certain categories, i.e. jeans. (If you haven't tried their denim yet, I urge you to do so—it's really good.) On top of just having great basics, they offer inclusive sizing and have epic sales. All things considered, I'm a fan.</p><p>Keep scrolling to shop pieces from the 7 basics categories I've been buying from Madewell for the past decade.</p><p>I love a good oversized button-down, and Madewell definitely gets me in that respect. The Ex-Boyfriend and Courier styles, in particular, are long-time favorites of mine.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979216460-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979219831-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979237596-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979225362-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979234630-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979150763-image.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>If I could only recommend one thing from Madewell, it would be jeans. Whether you're into skinny, straight, baggy, or flared style, they have it all, and the fit of every style they tackle is excellent.</p><p><figure><img As proof, I often find that they're one of the first things to sell out in each new collection. </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979223150-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979227094-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979228416-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979227817-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288724/madewell-basics-288724-1597979146840-image.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>If you just want to stock up on easy, affordable sweaters, Madewell is an excellent place to do so. Ever","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/huk6UieGJ2E/most-popular-designer-handbags","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1581560801280-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Every season, new handbag trends make their way into the street style world, and each season, we eagerly scout said accessories. Right now, it's the super-tiny purses that seem too small to hold even a tube of lipstick and those incredibly unique styles sure to liven up your look in an instant that are reigning supreme. They're fashion-forward and have a serious street style star backing. Sometimes, though, it's the classic <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/spring-bags\" target=\"_blank\">designer handbags</a> you simply can't say no to because they are just that—classic.</p><p>If you're unsure about which luxury piece to splurge on, consider turning to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-luxury-handbags-resale-value\" target=\"_blank\">the most popular designer bags</a> ever. It's no easy feat to earn such a title, and though many come attached with a pretty big price tag, they're worth the splurge and deserve a spot in your collection. They've been the most sought-after year after year (just take a look at the street style stars as proof), and they'll continue to be a great pick for seasons to come. Ready to see our roundup of the 10 most popular <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-designer-bags-2020\" target=\"_blank\">designer bags</a>, based on our street style research? Read on to see and shop them below.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1583186663243-main.1200x1277uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Named after Jane Birkin, this bag has been coveted since its inception in 1984. The BBC revealed how it came to be: \"Its existence was a happy accident, borne out of an exchange between Birkin and former Hermès chief executive Jean-Louis Dumas on an Air France flight from Paris to London in the early ’80s,\" the BBC wrote. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1597724005024-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1583186673438-main.1200x1218uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Nothing says luxury like a Chanel bag. Quilted designs have been an integral part of the brand's history since Coco Chanel herself designed this bag in 1955. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1597725412639-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1583186698185-main.1200x1313uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This bag is popular because of the unmistakable Louis Vuitton logo and practical shape. Louis Vuitton arguably paved the way for the designer logo craze that is still going strong in 2020. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1597724356664-main.800x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1549591219176-main.1080x810uc.jpg\"><figcaption>A handbag roundup is not complete without mentioning Gucci. The GG logo is extremely recognizable and is closely associated with Italian luxury. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1597724566010-main.2000x3001uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1583186712332-main.1200x1268uc.jpg\"><figcaption>We'll just go ahead and say it: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen are basically single-handedly responsible for the popularity of this bag. They carried it nonstop in the early 2000s and it became instantly iconic. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1597724737488-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1581560768686-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Dior's version first Saddle Bag debuted in 1999 when John Galliano was still at the helm of the house, and its high resale value is proof that it's still coveted today. Rosie Huntington-Whiteley and Rihanna are among the celebrities who own this chic style. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1597724875627-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1583186725945-main.1200x1202uc.jpg\"><figcaption>While Chanel and Louis Vuitton bags are recognizable to the masses, Loewe bags are a bit more niche for fashion girls in the know—making them all the more desirable for discerning customers. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1585597559265-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1583186746230-main.1200x849uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Another one of Louis Vuitton's winning designs is the Neverfull bag, which launched in 2007 to great fanfare. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1597725022288-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1583186760131-main.1200x1129uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Don't forget about Chloé! The iconic French house has produced its fair share of It bags over the years, but the Faye bag has retained a particularly impressive resale value. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1597725109803-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/276769/most-popular-designer-handbags-276769-1549591445501-main.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Last but not least, it's the bag everyone dreams of: Chanel's Flap Bag. Sleek and simple yet totally elegant, it's no wonder why it's still selling like crazy in 2020. Approved","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/EUNuoGQJd5A/fall-lip-colors","description":"<p>Fall is right around the corner, and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/makeup-trends-from-instagram\" target=\"_blank\">the fashion set</a> has already zeroed in on the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/charlotte-tilbury-hot-lips-2-collection\" target=\"_blank\">lip colors</a> we'll all be coveting this season. It's hard to believe the time has already come to start tailoring our hair, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/section/skin\" target=\"_blank\">skin</a>, and makeup routines to the upcoming cooler climate, but after a long Hot Girl Summer, we're honestly ready for a Chill Girl Fall. (No, seriously, can we make that a thing?)</p><p>Just in time for the seasonal shift, we slid into the DMs of some of our <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fashion-girl-makeup-buys\" target=\"_blank\">most fashionable friends</a> to get the scoop on the lippies they're already loving. From berry tints to versatile nudes and even some super-bright and happy hues, our trusty crew gave us the details on the fall lip colors they'll be imprinting on the lids of their pumpkin spice lattes.</p><p>Ahead, find eight shades that made the cut, and where to get them.</p><p><figure><img about the pieces that <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/cheap-one-piece-swimsuits\" target=\"_blank\">get us the most compliments</a>. These days, the only people seeing my outfits are my parents and my dogs, so I'll spare you their biased takes on my summer looks. However, I'll still tell you that I've lived in <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/amazon-dresses\" target=\"_blank\">easygoing dresses</a> for months now. Although I've been on a strict budget during the quarantine, I am willing to spend money on classic dresses. </p><p>If you're ready to make the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/why-invest-in-designer-accessories\" target=\"_blank\">investment</a> too, you've come to the right place. I came up with a handful of my favorite dress trends that will definitely stand the test of time. src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-wishlist-288007-1594140342571-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>My home has a \"closet\" that's truly offensive in every sense of the word. It's in the corner of my bedroom and can maybe hold, I don't know, a shoe or two. So my husband and I had to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/affordable-home-decor\" target=\"_blank\">turn our second bedroom </a>into a space with clothes racks and a dresser just so I had a place to hang and store things. I know what you're thinking: You have an entire room dedicated to your clothes? Well technically, <em>yes</em>, but we never wanted the room to feel like a closet, so I'm limited to two clothes racks and an overstuffed dresser. I know—cue the violins.</p><p>Now, before the pandemic, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/outdated-spring-trends\" target=\"_blank\">I was good about getting rid of things I didn't wear regularly</a>. But nowadays, that's gotten harder for me to do. I'm not wearing the same things I used to wear when, you know, I <em>actually</em> had places to be. So how do I know if I'm actually over something? Despite this conundrum, my urge to shop is in full force, as is my lack of inspiration with my current wardrobe. With that being said, I'm willing to get rid of stuff just so I can freshen things up around here. Here are 36 cheap Amazon pieces I'm willing to make room for that won't plague me with buyer's remorse, either.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-wishlist-288007-1594140382966-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This is giving me major vacation vibes with zero traveling needed.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-wishlist-288007-1594140391011-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I can't stop thinking about all of the high-waist bottoms I can wear this with. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-wishlist-288007-1594140410898-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>How is this only $20?</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-wishlist-288007-1594140420775-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>It's true: I'm still not over tie-dye. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-wishlist-288007-1594140428871-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The high neck on this is just *chef's kiss*.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-fashion-wish-list-288007-1594144686640-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This looks way more expensive than $17. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-wishlist-288007-1594140518204-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I mean, do I need to even say how pretty this color is?</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288007/amazon-summer-wishlist-288007-1594140524713-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I don't even care that these are for younger girls—I'll squeeze myself into a large and call it a day. Sneakers","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/fjyS4PQs50o/dress-and-sneaker-outfits","description":"<p>While you may be wearing a lot of cool sweats outfits these days, I thought a bit of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/cute-easy-outfit-ideas\" target=\"_blank\">summer-outfit inspiration</a> could be of interest to either test out now or save and reference in the future. Specifically, I wanted to focus on cute dress ensembles. But I’m not talking about crazy high-concept looks here. Instead, I wanted to zero in on some of the prettiest outfits I’ve seen over the last few months that feature just <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/diane-kruger-topshop-dress\" target=\"_blank\">dresses and sneakers</a>.</p><p>What you’ll notice in the ’fits highlighted in the IG imagery coming your way is the dress silhouettes featured are statement-making enough on their own that they don’t really require much else other than a comfy pair of kicks. With all that in mind, keep scrolling to uncover a new chic look to try and shop inspired pieces, if you’re shopping at the moment.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288037/summer-fashion-staples-timeless-288037-1593712863830-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Ask 10 people what their go-to summer staples are and you'll likely get ten different answers. Some lean toward <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/summer-instagram-fashion-trends\" target=\"_blank\">trendier picks</a> while others like to stick to the classics, and somewhere in the latter group falls my incredibly stylish mother <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-loungewear-brands-over-50\" target=\"_blank\">who's actually no stranger to this whole contributor thing</a>. </p><p>Taking that (and the fact that <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/summer-nordstrom-shopping\" target=\"_blank\">summer is finally here</a>) into consideration, I recently decided to tap her and have her share just what she thinks the most timeless and investment-worthy warm-weather essentials are. Graciously, she delivered, providing us with eight undeniably important picks from <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/dresses-for-home-target\" target=\"_blank\">frocks</a> to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/cheap-summer-shoes-sandals\" target=\"_blank\">footwear</a>, and today, you get to read about each one and, of course, shop them in <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/under-49-affordable-summer-shopping\" target=\"_blank\">a range of styles and price points</a>. href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/victoria-beckham-least-favorite-trends\" target=\"_blank\">Victoria Beckham</a> is on the least shocking end of the spectrum. Her collections are reliably chic, pared-back and she often sticks to more modest silhouettes. If you're not familiar with her runway looks, think <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/amazon-dresses\" target=\"_blank\">midi dresses</a>, long skirts, oversize shirts, and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-shopping-staples\" target=\"_blank\">great tailoring</a>. So then, it wassurprising to find the former pop star wearing what can only be described as hot pants.</p><p>The designer shared a photo of herself and husband David this week, and while she wore a signature loose-fitting <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/meghan-markle-shorts-sneakers-face-mask\" target=\"_blank\">button-down shirt</a> with the sleeves rolled up, she completed the outfit with the tiniest of white shorts. But this isn't the first time she's worn this look this summer. Way back during the lockdown, VB wore a pair of denim short shorts along with a black shirt and a pair of slippers. So, we can only come to the conclusion that Victoria is into this look. Ready to see her outfits? Then keep scrolling and shop the chicest hot pants on offer right now. </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288683/victoria-beckham-hot-pants-288683-1597770248116-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>On Victoria Beckham: Victoria Beckham Cotton Shirt </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288683/victoria-beckham-hot-pants-288683-1597770246361-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Style Notes: Don't love white shorts? src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/263385/best-sports-bras-for-running-263385-1595801660910-image.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Whether you've been running like a pro for years on end or are just getting started, one of the best aspects of the sport is how accessible it is for just about anyone. And while you may have already bought <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-running-sneakers-by-foot--5b187c805a75f\">the best shoes</a> on the market, there's one other thing to really consider before you head out the door: the best sports bras for running. While it certainly doesn't hurt that you can wear some of the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/what-to-wear-running\">chicest outfits</a> on your regular jogs, having the right sports bra will make all the difference—trust us.</p><p>To make sure your runs are as comfortable as possible, we asked model and personal trainer <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=WUEg2gQ_Y-CPVxBAD5gtUKp-I2anSrEFbteshymglyO_OoZ_gC0P5YN0c1kyIwktPpRNhZ9sJTXTDPd9jQ\" target=\"_blank\">Jill de Jong</a> what to look for when shopping for your sports bras. \"When I look for a sports bra, I look for soft, stretchy fabrics because comfort is key and you feel better the more often and longer you run,” she tells us. “For larger busts, get good coverage and support. A lot of cute, fashionable bras will look great but aren't ideal to run in.\"</p><p>With that in mind, start shopping our favorite <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-sports-bras-ever-according-to-real-women\">sports bras</a> that will give you all the support you need for your next run.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/263385/best-sports-bras-for-running-263385-1595866693446-main.900x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>There were so many glowing reviews for this Outdoor Voices bra that it was hard to just pick one. Promising review: \"Most comfortable highly supportive bra I've ever purchased. Have been searching for a new running bra for months, and finally landed on a keeper! Also, absolutely love the zip feature.\" — Spencer</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/263385/best-sports-bras-for-running-263385-1595802222463-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption>It doesn't get any more classic than this Nike bra. Promising review: \"I run nearly every day and this is my classic go-to bra. 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"I Currently Own 29 Pairs of Jeans, But These Are the Only 7 I Actually Wear","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/XoHdtjIIhrg/best-comfortable-jeans","description":"<p class=\"p1\">It’s been 14 years since living together in <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-fashion-trends-2020\" target=\"_blank\">New York</a>, but my ex-roommate still loves to tell the story of “Judith’s Jeans.” My bedroom in Apt. 27 was essentially a glorified closet, yet a quarter of the small space was taken up by a mound of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/straight-leg-jeans\" target=\"_blank\">jeans</a> quite literally from floor to ceiling.</p><p class=\"p1\">Fast-forward 14 years to my apartment in <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/local-european-review\" target=\"_blank\">L.A</a>., and not much has changed (aside from more square footage). My denim obsession remains resolute. What can I say? I love jeans, and when I find a pair that fits well and looks good, it’s hard to resist. I currently own about 29 pairs (some gifted, some scored secondhand, some I scooped up in sales, and some <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-online-luxury-fashion-retailers\" target=\"_blank\">investment</a> jeans I’ve splurged on), yet I fully acknowledge that owning this many is not exactly normal (and, to be honest, a tad embarrassing). I came up with this article idea after <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-fashion-under-50\" target=\"_blank\">cleaning my closet</a>, and as I sifted through my denim collection, I realized even though I like all of them, there are actually only seven I love to wear on repeat. Go figure!</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597863250594-main.3024x4032uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>So below, I’m highlighting my seven favorites that I wear <em>all the time</em>. Not only are they comfortable, but their silhouettes hit me right, they flatter my body, and I love the quality. Now, I’m off to Goodwill!</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597861396816-main.1080x1146uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Citizens of Humanity is one of my favorite denim brands because of its excellent quality and fit. (As you'll see, they appear on my top-seven list more than once.) While they tend to be on the pricier side, they're worth every penny, as I wear them so darn much. The Charlotte is the perfect straight-leg silhouette, and the high rise hits my waistline just right. I also love the vintage-inspired wash that combines well with everything in my closet. Moreover, they're surprisingly super comfortable despite being non-stretch.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597873789926-main.2608x4032uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597862322502-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597863581133-main.1080x1240uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Okay, another Citizens of Humanity pair coming at you—and I could seriously rave about these jeans all day. If you're looking for a stretchy pair with a slimmer cut (but not über-skinny), then these are ideal. First off, they are supremely comfortable. (Thank you, elastane.) This particular wash is perfect for so many scenarios. It's easy to dress up with heels and a nice top or pair with a chic blouse for work, and it also looks amazing with a simple white tee and sneakers. I find the high-waisted ankle-length silhouette is ultra-versatile.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597863659389-main.1080x1263uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597863914499-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597864077189-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I absolutely love the vintage look and feel of these classic Levi's 501s. I actually scored these at a vintage market, but after a quick search, they're pretty easy to find online. These are rigid and non-stretch, so at first, they may seem a little uncomfortable, until you wear them in. I don't usually get compliments on my jeans, but when I wear these, I always (graciously) receive a ton.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597872345382-main.1080x1349uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597865721773-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597867146559-main.2496x3978uc.jpg\"><figcaption>When it comes to skinny jeans, I tend to wear two on rotation. This gray wash from H&M and a Madewell pair (which I'll talk more about below). This pair from H&M is super stretchy, comfortable, and fits really well. They're easy to throw on with blazers and boots or with sneakers or sandals. Plus, you can't go wrong with the price!</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597867690050-main.1080x1079uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597868596694-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597867734883-main.1080x1161uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The other pair of skinny jeans I wear a ton are from Madewell—another denim brand I love. These super-soft black skinny jeans are extremely versatile and easy to move around in. I like styling them with knee-high boots in the colder months and minimalist sandals in summer.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597868378262-main.1280x1626uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597868495073-main.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I've really loved the resurgence of the '70s flare and wide-leg silhouettes, which have been trending for the past few seasons and are set to be huge for fall. Agolde's vintage high-rise flare jeans are my favorite, as the silhouette is wonderful, and they're made of 100% organic cotton, which is super soft to the touch.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597868830173-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597869640000-main.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I've been leaning into casual, loose-fitting jeans a lot more lately given our current circumstances, and Paige's Noella Straight style has been my go-to. It has a cropped silhouette and is slightly distressed, giving it a relaxed feel. But the best part? It's seriously comfortable.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597869831826-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597870473574-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption>If you're looking for a straight-leg style, these have \"new favorite pair\" written all over them.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597871073978-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Ivory jeans are having a major moment this season.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597870379977-main.1280x1626uc.jpg\"><figcaption>There's a reason these are a best seller.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288707/best-comfortable-jeans-288707-1597870132917-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Levi's Wedgie Icon jeans remain a fashion-girl favorite.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882916171-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>By now you know what to do. We're a number of days deep into <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/nordstrom-beauty-sale\" target=\"_blank\">Nordstrom's highly anticipated Anniversary Sale</a>, and all of the most coveted items are quickly flying from the retailer's (theoretical) beauty- and fashion-stocked shelves. <strong>From August 19 through 30, you can score up to 40% off on a significant portion of <a class=\"link link--story\" href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/sephora-welcome-back-event-august-2020\" target=\"_blank\">your beauty wish list</a>, and folks, the going is <em>good</em>. </strong>As in, high-demand brands like <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/overrated-skincare-products\" target=\"_blank\">La Mer,</a> <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/charlotte-tilbury-makeup-review\" target=\"_blank\">Charlotte Tilbury,</a> Nars, NuFace, Oribe, Dermaflash, and so many more, are offering some of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/holy-grail-skincare-products\" target=\"_blank\">their most beloved items</a> at significantly reduced prices. What's more, some of said products are available in limited-edition jumbo sizes, two-packs, three-packs, and every other conceivable way we like to take our beauty products.</p><p>With so much to choose from (and because I'm a beauty nerd—what can I say?), I've spent the past five hours or so sifting through all of the goods. Of course, you can't go wrong, and overall, the assortment is full of the crème de la crème, but below, I'm ranking 20 of the most exciting finds in order of how I'd stack them in your shopping cart. Keep scrolling! </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882924340-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The fact that this set is up for grabs at $225 when it's worth more than $600 is pretty astounding. If you're looking to cover (literally) every skincare base, this luxe set is one of the best bargains within Nordstrom's Anniversary Sale assortment. You'll score 40 Correct and Brighten Beta Hydroxy Daily Exfoliating Pads, a full-size Beauty Booster Eye Serum, a full-size Beauty Booster Serum, a full-size Beauty Booster Oil, a full-size Beauty Booster Anti-Fatigue Cream SPF 30, a full-size Even Skin Vitamin C Cream, two Correct and Brighten Weekly Peels, one Instant Solutions Triangle of Light Eye Mask, and one travel-size Gentle Cleansing Wash.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882935175-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Consider this your ultimate skin-protecting and brightening dynamic duo. It comes complete with two (full-size) heavy hitters from the skin maestros at Estée Lauder: its Perfectionist Pro Multi-Defense UV Fluid SPF 45 Sunscreen and its Perfectionist Pro Rapid Brightening Treatment.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597968358415-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I never stray far from my collection of Hourglass makeup. For blurred yet still natural-looking coverage, I can't recommend its holy-grail loose setting powder and primer enough. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882943320-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I'm super picky about my makeup brushes, and after hearing makeup artist after makeup artist rave about MAC's professional-caliber options, I pretty much stick to the brand exclusively for any and all brush needs. They're high-quality and have super-long life expectancies, which makes them expensive. This discounted set is such a fabulous get. (I might order multiple so I'm set for life.)</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882948250-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Here lies a complete regimen to tackle practically any and all skincare woes but most notably enlarged pores and loss of elasticity. BeautyBio's set helps firm and tone every inch of your face thanks to an all-star lineup featuring its GloPro Microneedling Rejuvenation Tool, full-size Ultimate Vitamin C Facial Moisturizer, GloPro Eye MicroTip Attachment, Bright Eyes Colloidal Silver Eye Gels, and handy Skin Prep Pads, which help remove impurities before you begin the rest of your regimen.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882959672-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Controversial opinion, but Nars's hit mascara called Climax might be our favorite naughtily named mascara. This well-priced set allows you to give it a test drive on your lashes while also decking out your lids and cheekbones with the prettiest, fall-perfect shades. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597968665089-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This is one of the only brow-growth formulas that hasn't given me a lick of irritation, and I appreciate how safe and nutritious it is. The proprietary blend of scientifically advanced peptides, revitalizing extracts, and nutritive vitamins deliver visible polished results. Plus, what's better than getting two full-size tubes for the price of one?</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882967911-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Though it might sound high-maintenance, my silk pillowcase habit has completely spoiled me for any other kind of pillowcase. These Slip ones reign supreme, and I've noticed a huge difference in both my hair and skin health since I made the switch. Since they're not all too budget-friendly on the regular, I wait for sales (like this one!) to stock up.  </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882973819-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I'm of the firm belief that every single person should own at least one perfume from Jo Malone London in their lifetime. The brand is so classic, and the colognes are uncomplicated yet beautiful—the type of fragrance that you wear versus it wearing you. Does that make sense? Anyhow, I'm personally psyched to add this mini discovery set to my cart. You'll get (my favorite) Jo Malone cologne—Wood Sage & Sea Salt—plus its English Pear & Freesia candle and fan-favorite Peony & Blush Suede Body Crème.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882981854-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>One of the biggest takeaways I've learned as a beauty editor who regularly talks to, DMs, and interviews celebrity makeup artists is the truth that skin prep is just as (or more) important than your makeup application. I've dabbled with lots of products, but Charlotte Tilbury's iconic face formulas always deliver the best results, even when I'm broken-out, dehydrated, or sleep-deprived. Her concoctions really are the closest thing to magic on the skincare market and do provide instant gratification. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882986911-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I would honestly be terrified to know how much money I've wasted on completely ineffective supplements over the years. That said, one brand I always come back to is Moon Juice. SuperYou is a great adaptogenic option for anyone looking to improve energy, focus, stress reactions, and mood in one adorably packaged go. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882992010-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This beloved curling iron from GHD is a must-have for plenty of celebrity hairstylists, and it's also one of the few models that effortlessly works with all hair types, textures, and lengths. It's easy to use, fuss-free, and even guarantees less damage.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597882997291-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I don't know about you, but quality hours of sleep have been few and far between this year, and I've been leaning (extremely) heavily into my collection of eye creams, masks, gels, serums, what have you. As if on cue, Nordstrom struck a deal on two of my absolute favorite things to help cure my eye woes. If you haven't had the chance to try Chantecaille's 24-karat-gold and plant-stem-cell eye masks and serum, you're in for an extra-special treat. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597883002870-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I basically consider myself a Fresh fiend. I love, hoard, and regularly recommend pretty much every and any product it makes to anyone who will listen. This set just so happens to house a few of my all-time-favorite things: a handy travel/test-it size of the cult-favorite Soy Face Cleanser alongside three skin-loving masks. They're perfect for tucking into your suitcase the next time you get the heck out of dodge but don't want to sacrifice your glow. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597883007569-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Truth: I've tried every single expensive hair dryer, and this one from T3 is the one I always come back to and gift my friends and family with. (Two years later, and my mom still brings it up in almost every phone conversation.) It's an investment, but this major discount is the best excuse to go ahead and treat yourself. (Your strands will thank you!)</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597883013888-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This has been the year of many at-home beauty experiments. I've officially swapped my previous in-office treatments (like exfoliating microdermabrasion) for nifty devices that create similar results at home. This microdermabrasion-inspired tool from PMD does just that and even comes with additional attachments to address rough, built-up skin in other stubborn areas like the hands and feet. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597883017950-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Honestly, I don't really remember what life was like before I had my beloved Dermaflash device. Easy to use and non-irritating, it's the quickest, low-lift way to eradicate dead skin cell buildup and peach fuzz for a svelter, smoother, far more sculpted facial appearance. (Truly, it's quite magical!) </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597968931357-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Drybar is one of our favorite haircare brands, so you can understand why we're so excited about this kit of essentials, which includes the Brush Crush Heated Straightening Brush, Super Lemon Drop Detangling Brush, full-size Prep Rally Prime & Prep Detangler, travel-size Hot Toddy Heat Protectant Mist, and travel-size Detox Original Scent Dry Shampoo. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597883030173-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I only ever buy La Mer when I can get it on a deal. Plus, I actually prefer buying mini sizes for two reasons: A) They're perfect for travel, even the road trips that have defined 2020, and B) La Mer's formulas are so lush and high-quality you literally need only the tiniest bit per application. Thus, travel-size sampling actually lasts a lot longer than you'd expect and allows you to really test the formula's efficacy before you go for the all-out sprint (aka, a super-spendy full size). This set features the brand's most iconic products: Crème de la Mer Moisturizing Cream, The Replenishing Oil Exfoliator, The Regenerating Serum, The Eye Concentrate, and one Treatment Lotion Hydrating Mask.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288708/best-nordstrom-anniversary-sale-beauty-2020-288708-1597969153691-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This famed microcurrent device is one of the most expensive items on my beauty want list. Considering it's more than $100 off, now's the time to bite. While the brand makes multiple tools and devices, this one is specifically meant to tone, firm, and smooth your body. href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/meghan-markle-los-angeles-outfits\" target=\"_blank\">Meghan Markle</a> and Prince Harry have been settling into their new Southern California life at home, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=itPsKnrnq77n6VKHgqIJqjEnBL3mQhgYlmuDsl9HaUN8EjhWaaioUMyy8HCC3BAerI8M7vH87hZFqJP35TiWMFjPCZ47NJp2LkPtzMdRtw1tVKRFUluqlCElXYi_Klhf0Q2TdfQW5AW_Pnkqzv6rjjWeGlvQLgNJvX-HLaF9tmIGvG1FAuNv6IJz1BRZFKwHai2JGj8mKkj4is3soKjkjzBsjmZJ9mJsw9sPsYV830SfZru3_S9rownN2z33F0dRuHzANHaNt8dvGXaOTPkaH01IulBsdUHwMGxA7iCtQBccFR02XLqcY0GnH0Z1ulqOWCPRyWDbL2_yNp-L_0eebjcKO9NxLcPKzzXx5QxL_1eFuQKR2w\" target=\"_blank\">Zooming</a> up a storm for various causes they support. But this week they made an in-person visit to help the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=2TdkCDqMuDNCUkoCGOBF45vvL0XV1AOb5cD8c_MZXAE_kt1N7Q4\" target=\"_blank\">Baby2Baby charity</a>, which provides diapers, clothes, and other essentials to children and families in poverty. They handed out supplies at a school in South Los Angeles wearing casual outfits fitting for the blistering heatwave. </p><p>Markle wore a Victoria Beckham white button-down shirt and her favorite Adidas <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/splash/zBpnkkzyn?w=3696226\" target=\"_blank\">Stan Smith Sneakers</a> ($80). But perhaps the best part of her laidback outfit was her safe-and-chic Royal Jelly <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=GOdwiY_SvKVKYzU4TX3eGVHtgYTVyTnpCcY948gvqnV3qdhYPVVkYvN6NgLDVD2YrbDBxAUFy43KDOOmvDrrAlDhpDTFslFIc0was3kqQ7o0ywYEKWh4cqosw6Ozv36At2p18fLdvja5Pi7hVCnWP_E\" target=\"_blank\">Harlem Mask in Blue Seersucker</a> ($15). With <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/kate-middleton-face-mask\" target=\"_blank\">Kate Middleton opting for a floral face mask</a> and now Meghan opting for a stylish striped version, one thing's for certain: it's royally-approved to wear a <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/stylish-face-masks\" target=\"_blank\">face mask</a> that suits your own personal style. Younger","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/oJYUkbBDt8o/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin","description":"<p><em>Melissa Meyers is a Los Angeles–based influencer with a focus on beauty, style, travel, and wellness. Her blog, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=RTMKnshLe1_qFmsfI1MTfV4-ObH8BIrDSxblx0tqpv3tq5cwO7M4DYbNpw\" target=\"_blank\">The Glow Girl,</a> aims to empower women to embrace the best version of themselves, age gracefully, and cultivate a glow from the inside out. She also happens to be a <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/melissa-meyers-glow-girl-zara\" target=\"_blank\">54-year-old</a> with a passion for clean beauty. Below, hear from Meyers on her favorite natural skincare, makeup, and hair formulas. Plus, how she uses them in her daily routine.</em></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310421840-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I find that as I approach my mid-50s, my skin and body are getting more and more sensitive to what I put on them. Over the past year, I’ve been making an effort to incorporate and use clean, safe beauty products in my life in order to reduce my exposure to toxic chemicals. In doing so, my allergies have improved, I feel mentally clearer and physically better, and I know exactly what I’m putting on my skin. I don't want to compromise on my health or the quality and performance of my beauty and skincare products, which is why I'm excited to share some amazing clean beauty products I use to help me look and feel 10 years younger.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310428985-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310434679-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This classic daily moisturizer by Ere Perez, Moringa All-Beauty Crème, contains nutritious ingredients that just melt into the skin, soothing dryness and tired skin, and leaving my complexion glowing. I find it to be the perfect base for under makeup and use it as my first layer of hydration. Hero ingredients include moringa—known to accelerate skin cell renewal—apricot kernel oil to firm and tone, lemon balm for powerful antioxidants, and prickly pear, which is loaded with vitamin E for healthy skin! This brand is recent discovery for me, and I'm obsessed not only with their overall skincare line but also with their makeup line.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310440581-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Barbara Sturm is the queen of clean skincare, offering up products that are proven to work to diminish signs of aging fine lines and wrinkles. She formulates all her products herself, and combines the power of science and natural ingredients. I love several of her products, but in particular the eye cream, which targets dark circles, bags and puffiness. I have a sensitive eye area, and have found this fragrance-free product to be super potent, gentle and effective! Since using this cream, I’ve noticed the bags under my eyes have calmed down significantly—our eyes tell our age, so it’s a great product to invest in if you want to take years off your face without actually going under the knife!</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310449006-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Versed is a newly launched, well-priced clean beauty brand created by one of Who What Wear's co-founders, Katherine Power. I've been road-testing several products within the line and have been regularly using this hyaluronic acid formula. This serum booster is so light and disappears into the skin effortlessly—I add it daily to my face moisturizer for an extra hydration boost. It gives my dry skin the extra love it needs to stay super moist throughout the day! Yes, please!</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310455518-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Natural face oils are my top beauty secret; I'm obsessed! My fave ones are by a small company called Olìe Biologique that specializes in natural face oils. Their oils are 100% pure and luxurious, and they contain the best botanical ingredients that are proven effective. I loved their rejuvenating face oil so much that I reached out the company (before oils were a thing) and contacted the founder to see if we could create a formula together. Flash-forward to the launch of the Olìe x Melissa Meyers face oil. They're currently sold out, but we're working on an exciting new formula with French marine algae.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310682131-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This exfoliator from Goop is a natural skincare product that literally polishes away any roughness and smooths uneven areas. This instant Microderm exfoliating treatment has been called a “powerful facial in a little jar,” and it’s comprised of natural ingredients and essential oils, micro-exfoliating minerals, and glycolic acid. It’s truly a dual-action product, offering the benefits of both physical and chemical exfoliation. The results for refreshed glowing skin are instant, and they offer a subscription option so that you can be sure to never run out!</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310689901-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I wear this product from Coola every single day because it’s one of the best multitaskers I’ve found in natural beauty. It’s an amazing skin-perfecting moisturizer with light/sheer coverage that leaves your skin even-toned and dewy! It comes in three shades depending on your skin tone; I like to use the medium-deep shade for a sun-kissed glow. Coola’s eco-conscious formulas are locally sourced with a Farm to Face® philosophy and are scientifically advanced… This is something I can get behind; I use a variety of the brand’s sun protection products from head to toe.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310909126-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Founded by wellness entrepreneur Miranda Kerr out of her passion for all things holistic and natural, Kora Organics offers some of the best-certified organic skincare products I’ve tested. I recently discovered the line and was blown away by how much I love the toxin-free products designed to safely enrich your skin. I have so many faves but for starters, the Allure Best in Beauty award–winning Noni Glow Body Oil is certainly one to try. This oil immediately absorbs into the skin, and the scent is heavenly. I like to mix it in with my body moisturizer, and then finish with it on my legs and arms before heading out for youthful, glowy skin. I’m a huge fan of oils, an absolute staple for allover moisture for both face and body.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310922297-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>As we age, our hair changes texture and needs extra love. I’ve been on the search for clean haircare products that leave my hair looking and feeling its best, but are also sulfate- and silicon-free. Say hello to Innersense! All of the brand’s products have an amazing spa-fresh scent and contain certified-organic plant ingredients that deliver hydration, health, moisture, shine and protection. I’m not the only one obsessed with the hydrating cream and conditioner, as both have won Allure’s Best in Beauty awards! Ingredients include certified organic monoi oil and aloe that strengthen the hair follicle, smooth cuticles and control frizz. My hair looked super shiny and hydrated after the first use. They have travel-sized trios you so can try several of their products depending on your hair needs.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310930382-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/282439/clean-beauty-products-for-mature-skin-282439-1568310934877-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I also use and switch off with Gloss Moderne hair products, a minimalist, natural, luxury haircare collection made from the highest-quality and health-forward ingredients. 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"NYC Girls Won't Go Near These Current Trends","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/3snio6l87Iw/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate","description":"<p>There are trends, and then there are<a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/nyc-summer-outfits\" target=\"_blank\"> NYC trends</a>. New York fashion girls have more than just the seasonal hype of a product to consider when choosing which trends they want to invest in, including functionality, breathability, and much more. Thanks to the infuriating heat and unavoidable walking and schlepping, rocking the latest heel trend might be tempting, but it can be far from practical. Get the picture?</p><p>Ahead I reached out to some of my <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/nyc-summer-street-style-outfits\" target=\"_blank\">favorite NYC girls </a>to find out which fashion trends they are hating at the moment, in addition to the ones they are loving. Luckily, there are a lot of kitschy<a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/sandal-trends-2020\" target=\"_blank\"> summer 2020 trends </a>to consider, meaning the styles listed below are both exciting <em>and</em> practical. </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496178388-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"Platform sneakers are having a moment right now, but they're just not for me. At 5'8\", I'm not dying for a height boost, and when I do want to add a little lift, I prefer a heel! A current trend I am really into is neons—I'm basically treating neon pink like a neutral this summer.\" — Michelle Salem</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411247612-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1559919132009-product.920x1380uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411299039-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496177170-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"In general, I am not a huge fan of super-tight clothing, but I am especially against it in this New York humidity. This summer, I'm gravitating toward anything flowy that will generate some sort of breeze.\" — Lauren Eggertsen</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411501337-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411530800-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411559707-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496169762-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"I love a good summery trend, but for some reason, I've always struggled with espadrilles. They look so cute on other women, but on me, I feel like they're a bit too beachy for the streets of NYC. Instead, I love great mule sandals.\" — Aemilia Madden</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1559920005545-product.920x1380uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411804051-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411808212-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531497331922-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p class=\"p1\">\"I'm really sick of the strap bag or fanny pack. It's been overdone in my opinion. I sort of associate it with festival style now. I'm all about kitschy fashion these days—I don't know what's gotten into me. Sign me up for crazy cheetah prints and anything cowboy-themed. The trick is having a futuristic take on it. For example, pair some matrix sunglasses or something that wouldn't normally work with it to make it your own.\" — Anaa Saber</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1559920415324-product.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412134879-main.2000x3001uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411922151-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496179080-image.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"As someone who prefers to stick to a more neutral palette, I will definitely be staying away from the neon color trend this season. However, I'm highly excited about all the animal print that's bubbling up right now and have already ordered these killer Reformation pants upon the suggestion of my co-worker Allyson Payer.\" — Nicole Akhtarzad</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412422591-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412431127-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412542144-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496176572-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>\"I'm not exactly sure how to name it, but the one trend I wouldn't go near is sheer clothing sans undergarments. I don't think I'll ever feel comfortable showing off my body in such a public way like that, but I respect other women who do, especially because it's a subtle form of resistance. Instead, the trend I'm wearing on repeat is midi skirts—I love to pair a high-waisted vintage skirt (ideally one that's asymmetrical) with a white tee or a tube top. It's such an easy outfit formula, and I always feel comfortable, even in this crazy heat.\" — Lauren Caruso</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412680206-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412956787-main.1660x2546uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412675476-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1595283295067-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><em>Next up, check out more <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/new-york-summer-style-2018--5b351cc04f9b6\" target=\"_blank\">fashion trends NYC girls are loving</a>.</em></p><p><em>This post was originally published on an earlier date and has since been updated. </em></p><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/3snio6l87Iw\" height=\"1\" width=\"1\"
