Eggertsen","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496178388-image.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn76@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-14-35-318_79ab641ed054e62e.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411247612-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn22@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-14-16-017_5f2281d4f88edec5.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1559919132009-product.920x1380uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn14@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-14-19-510_6eb8f53fd8175314.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411299039-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn2@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-32-073_1e76cb086a591fd1.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496177170-image.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn66@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-06-857_e040932ffa943928.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411501337-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn73@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-41-633_4acf6bb268b4e0fc.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411530800-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn75@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-55-483_701fe4dc363f4b1d.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411559707-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn27@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-14-12-018_b49400ae1ff88237.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496169762-image.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn94@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-36-844_d9a341cc298eec9b.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1559920005545-product.920x1380uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn64@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-58-607_285882085c06a339.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411804051-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn87@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-56-186_b4aaff86f1614dd5.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411808212-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn83@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-51-322_51208820f28a93e4.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531497331922-image.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn58@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-13-12-753_4071063d7e2d45da.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1559920415324-product.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn73@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-04-369_5530cbed2b153cdb.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412134879-main.2000x3001uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn94@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-13-19-503_a4d4a40bcd72f7c1.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594411922151-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn9@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-14-21-389_3d5115f3808ffd6d.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496179080-image.0x800uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn46@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-21-644_e37f83e19757a538.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412422591-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn29@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-14-16-624_454fb6558200466d.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412431127-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn36@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-49-888_ec22e12b6b7e5a80.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412542144-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn55@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-59-596_a867c1fbbd57a0ac.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/nyc-fashions-262957-1531496176572-image.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn90@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-31-712_82741e06d1342bf1.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412680206-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn93@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-14-17-151_f3880f5a38ec2ecd.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412956787-main.1660x2546uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn49@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-04-468_fb94eaca9ec5783d.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1594412675476-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn22@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-10-944_873a856258037943.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/262957/fashion-trends-nyc-girls-hate-262957-1595283295067-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn5@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-06-757_fd630d24a6c0f7f2.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/3snio6l87Iw":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn25@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-14-34-811_333aa08965ae2493.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598321581865},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"Hair Experts Reveal the Styles Women Over 50 Love","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/-r5Ft0fa0jM/short-hairstyles-for-older-women","description":"<p>I’m really sorry to say it, but when it comes to our body, time takes its toll on just about all of it. And although we know all too well what aging does to our skin, when it comes to other areas of our beauty regimens, age is rarely factored in. From swapping in <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.co.uk/best-anti-aging-serums\" target=\"_blank\">serums that tackle fine lines</a> and wrinkles to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.co.uk/how-to-use-skin-acids\" target=\"_blank\">acid treatments</a> that work against <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.co.uk/hyperpigmentation-treatments\" target=\"_blank\">age spots and pigmentation</a>, products that cater to aging skin seem to be everywhere.</p><p>But what about our hair? It turns out that besides going gray, aging can affect our hair in a number of ways. From <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.co.uk/haircuts-for-thin-hair\" target=\"_blank\">thinning</a> to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.co.uk/best-hair-masks-for-dry-hair\" target=\"_blank\">dryness</a>, the ways in which our hair deals with getting older means that as time goes by, we may need to change up our routines. And one of the most effective ways we can do that is by trying out a new haircut.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578996812146-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>As hair ages, it’s normal for it to become a little more difficult to style, meaning that it’s often all too appealing to chop it off. As we get older, keeping hair <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.co.uk/short-hairstyles-for-women\" target=\"_blank\">short</a> comes with its benefits. Not only does it keep locks looking healthy, but it also makes increasingly difficult-to-manage strands a lot easier to deal with.</p><p>Keep scrolling for all of the expert advice and inspiration that you might need if you’re over 50 and considering going short with your hair.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997002149-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>As we get older, so does our hair. Over time, the rate at which our body produces melanin (the thing that gives our hair pigment) slows down and eventually may even stop altogether, causing hair to lose its color and appear gray.</p><p>Alongside the loss of pigment, gray hairs often appear wiry and dry as a result of diminishing oil production by the sebaceous glands in the hair follicle. Jonathan Soons, creative ambassador at <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=fhcy9KwuJRLSF5Rb_WwpMdf6yIXVkVkBVJYZP-n0mq_RKCSvePZLMbadGu0\" target=\"_blank\">Headmasters</a>, explains: “The aging process changes the texture of hair so that it appears brittle, wiry, and frizzy. Commonly, the longer the hair is, the more this becomes evident.”</p><p>To deal with aging hair, Soons recommends switching your products up. “Older hair can be more fragile, so use a gentle brush such as <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=HPkJvG7R8ecDtq-e0yq9uiQQlw-iiWURglMYNBEwTyDR8UiHwdbjFymOqoStWJZ5x0zyMcgv7fcwlRnPvg5Dxli-hmcdaJ8hFpXM7lu0itGiDgx7MPuxLswlwFaxmdHOFRAzmB9dDsj5QlxTIvtg3bjaP7tmGmoiXRWbgybTbFUN26tx8H6T02bDhBadDY-iY2RrKz_Y5GYI6j4tJLzU6hrhpiSq_ej449q_BtJys83dhB2ln16fl6GfWpz2gaZfDZwdyWwdMgjjytR3i2k6f7i2GWQAnVYCmHKcAAoy6TP_OHl88rRWJi19CPx64n0jmtO28pnEbWh_VHdVzoX2vJRsBs2yQkMUIoYHtp9VVjpAnayzGunliJdxQFyVZtwO_OnBiSFdFysr6OHbLa8MCZYAAxH-_mzMUBPbHGAVZh_FfOUwJ-aPi8sqqC6CZxwfefnL-NmFZ-ixoZ2wxjea3A0YHXi8Ow2coXxi2hqiJFtVmGtnlWcY_oljfHFGNnXV5dudYw\" target=\"_blank\">Manta</a> ($30). To help keep gray hair fresh and remove yellow tones, I swear by <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=URhmZIIGW8OOWg6kEPy9aiAve_8sUM0C5natX62ZuIA8OSaczRwnwJREdBGrMT-ukYXbbRLwgfHpJ0EBPsEWGOGGvZf6HNhSLrw69lrr_KFORmHLPZBJ7Q\" target=\"_blank\">Revlon Professional Nutri Color Crème in 1002</a> ($18). As well as helping with color, it also acts as a mask to keep hair super moisturized,” says Soons.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997154182-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>As older hair becomes gradually more difficult to deal with, many women feel that going shorter helps to minimize the upkeep. Valerie Maine, a hairstylist at <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=a5uEEX6wP1vrjbV4KyJ11Sy1fRX2zdaKhieViV0HJJvo8_kE12nlhhbeQA\" target=\"_blank\">Live True</a> for <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=RQlWdCG4Vs6UI8CIVnKiEwOqD8dQ7ZASdahLJqJUYdlEeGgobEo1WFt3MUKGrqm1bli-KbOqJbQi\" target=\"_blank\">Redken</a>, reveals: “Short hair gives a feeling of a more youthful look. As you get older, your hair will sometimes thin and become weaker. Shorter hair is often easier to style and can fit in better with a busier lifestyle.”</p><p>Besides the fact that keeping hair short minimizes the appearance of age-induced damage that might be more evident with longer styles, going for the chop can also help disguise the side effects. “Short hair will often give the illusion of fuller and thicker hair and will disguise this,” says Maine.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997270958-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>As with any hair change, it’s important to know what you’re getting yourself into for before you go ahead. Of course, going short comes with the usual considerations such as whether or not your cut of choice will work with your texture and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.co.uk/how-to-make-your-hair-thicker\" target=\"_blank\">thickness</a>. However, when it comes to going short, there are other things to consider too.</p><p>As a rule, short hair tends to have to be styled more frequently than longer hair, and the general need for upkeep tends to be greater. When it comes to a short look that needs constant styling, it’s more important than ever to take the texture of your hair into account. “Consider the natural texture of your hair—if it is coarse, fine, straight, curly, etc. If you go for a style that ignores this, it will cause styling issues. Use your new short haircut to put emphasis on your favorite feature and showcase the areas you like the most. It could be your eyes, lips, or cheekbones, for example,” says Soons.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997443705-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>If you know that you want to go short but are unsure of where to start, worry not. Keeping scrolling to discover the short hairstyles women over 50 love, with all of the celebrity inspiration you might need.</p><p>If styling your hair is the last thing you want to think about in the morning, this low-maintenance cut could be for you. “For an older woman that has a natural curl or wave, the pixie cut is the best choice as it uses the hair’s natural pattern to create texture and volume. They are also relatively easy to style and maintain on a day to day basis,” says Maine.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997557084-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Considered the queen of pixie cuts, Dame Judi Dench’s textured cut creates the illusion of thick locks.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593711986108-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This edgy style is effortlessly cool.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997560013-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Short, straight and iconic. Jamie Lee Curtis is forever serving timeless hair inspiration.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593645986424-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This grown-out pixie cut is the epitome of cool. Plus, styling it out is more or less effortless.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997562159-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Ever so slightly longer than a traditional pixie cut, Ellen’s short-back-and-sides style is perfect for those who like to keep their hair regimens minimal.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593646606099-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>If the pixie cut seems a little too much of a statement, keeping a bit more length could be the perfect answer. A longer pixie style is also a great option for those that want to create an illusion of volume. Maine explains: “Longer layers can add volume, which is ideal if your hair is thinning and falling flat. The long pixie also gives a feminine touch when paired with a sweeping fringe.” </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997854404-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I’m head over heels for this swept-over style, which proves that a long pixie is one of the best cuts to create volume.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593710799854-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This voluminous cut is cropped in all the right places to accentuate this gorgeous curly texture.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997857285-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I’m not sure I could be any more obsessed with Emma Thompson’s bleached, swept-back cropped ’do. It oozes sophistication.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997858505-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>If you hate spending too long on your hair, this grown-out pixie style is perfect. Just a bit of styling paste is all you need.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578997863268-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Helen’s sweeping fringe adds the ultimate feminine touch on a longer pixie style.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593712134114-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This piecey cut frames the face so perfectly.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593646667869-main.1000x1000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Want to keep things simple? “A blunt bob keeps ends looking as fresh as possible. It can look quite quirky, a bit cool, and it’s really easy to style. This style works on wavy, straight, fine, medium, or thick hair, but for curly locks, go brave and cut to the jawline,” says Soons. But be warned: A blunt bob requires commitment. To keep it fresh, it’s advised that you book in for a trim every six to eight weeks.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1579171082147-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Although we might know Iman best for having long locks, for a brief period she sported this side-parted bob—blunt but still slightly choppy to create more shape. I'm obsessed.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578998179330-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I just have one question for Monica Bellucci: How does she get that shine?</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578998170756-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Okay, Sharon Stone, you win. Blow-drying a blunt bob back off the face and with serious volume is the perfect way to update a classic style.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578998175754-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Jodie Foster demonstrates how a blunt lob provides endless styling options. Perfect for those who like to switch up their look.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578998178099-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>For the evening, a side-parted bob with a loose curl is a super-chic option.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593646824637-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Break the traditional bob-haircut rules and opt for something a little cooler with this no-effort style. “For women who want to keep their length but want to add some life to their limp hair, the bob is a suitable haircut, as it still gives the feeling of having long hair whilst creating volume. Shaggy bob cuts are very popular, as they break the traditional bob haircut rules and create a more adventurous look,” says Maine.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578998517454-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>To give your bob an edge, take it a little shorter like Cate Blanchett. Just above the jawline is usually the sweet spot.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1579171079711-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Adding in a subtle fringe to her shaggy bob, Gayle King demonstrates perfectly how to add a classic touch to a timely style.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578998520115-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Ellen Barkin’s side-parted, bleach-blonde locks are igniting serious hair envy.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593711807602-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Viola's coils look super chic in a shaggy bob.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578998522366-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shaped around the face and styled into laid-back curls, Meg Ryan’s shaggy lob (long bob) is totally timeless.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284848/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-284848-1578998524753-image.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Now totally iconic, Jane Fonda’s super-layered bob might require daily styling, but I think it’s totally worth the work.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287552/short-hairstyles-for-older-women-287552-1593647017333-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><em><em>This post originally appeared It)","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/j-VA2D6RpQk/fall-shopping-target","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288686/fall-shopping-target-288686-1597775751006-image.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>What’s better than landing on the perfect piece to complete (or kickstart) <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-shopping-online\" target=\"_blank\">your next season's wardrobe</a>? I would say it’s finding one that’s both delightfully cheap and expensive looking. Whether it be a casual dress, non-basic t-shirt, or easy skirt that just happens to come with the perfect, matching top, there’s nothing like a great affordable find that you didn’t even have to wait until sale season for, am I right?</p><p>And, as you probably have guessed by now, today I’ve rounded up twenty fall-ready pieces that deliver all of the above and more. Before you get to praising me, you should know that thanks to the latest drop of our <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/section/who-what-wear-collection\" target=\"_blank\">Who What Wear collection for Target</a>, it wasn’t even that hard to do. All it took was a quick peruse through the new arrivals section—<a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/new-shopping-arrivals\">something I’m a big fan of doing, anyways</a>—and a little editing from there. If you've heard enough and are ready to get to shopping, just keep scrolling and when you're done, why not <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-sweater-trends\" target=\"_blank\">brush up on the most important fall sweater trends worth knowing</a> before the season officially starts. </p><p><figure><img 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"These 20 Nail Trends Will Be Everywhere in 2020","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/4XBTewRvYlI/nail-trends-2020","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576006759596-main.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><span>Since you’re reading Who What Wear, it’s probably safe to assume that you enjoy keeping up with the latest and greatest in fashion and beauty. Even if that’s not the case, odds are you like to experiment with your personal style every now and then, and what better way to dip your toes—erm, fingers—into a new trend than with your manicure? Taking a <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/peach-nail-colors\" target=\"_blank\">new nail color</a>, design, or technique for a test drive doesn’t have to be a major commitment, which is why we’re excited about experimenting with a bunch of exciting new nail trends in 2020. </span></p><p>Of course, as Who What Wear editors, we don’t just follow the trends—we discover them. Thanks to four of our favorite nail industry experts, we’re pretty sure these nail trends are going to be making waves in the next year (and new decade) to come. So whether you’re a <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/french-manicure-history\" target=\"_blank\">classic French manicure</a> devotee looking for a subtle way to change it up, enjoy experimenting every time you visit the nail salon, or prefer to go the DIY route at home, our experts have predicted 20 nail trends that should definitely be on your radar. </p><p><strong><span>Keep scrolling for incredible <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/summer-nail-designs\" target=\"_blank\">nail art inspiration</a>, subtle new shades, sleek designs, and even a few technical innovations to keep an eye out for according to the professionals behind buzzworthy brands </span><a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=RVTSCLz-qb-2TUM5m9H49syvWdc5AGfGUF2gSQmvf_cuHuB6cc0KtXlkYdvbn26S_-KzvhviQg\"><span>Olive & June</span></a><span>, </span><a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=tOCnwaKx-PNZUZLp7onjLI8nZPkLn42fNjZy5rl-m_cvYchcXOaUjPSkGnUv5Ptwl3Y4v15ZYDov9g\"><span>Mazz Hanna Beauty</span></a><span>, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=CsFDQD2TlCuXmNze9ECSlpoCZLbmcDFDjDsLt4OdyaBufkTwexBsqoc4KNkCll102c4\" target=\"_blank\">Jin Soon</a>, and </span><a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=LaiX8ZvSEUWYWelSmS_uGQvf32_NBbDPq8GKxPP4eF0nQ2psHkahQAmkkl1LsC4U7y-q3GT-\"><span>Varnish Lane</span></a><span>. These women definitely know what’s up when it comes to the latest and greatest in nail care—just don’t forget the topcoat! </span></strong></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576000618668-main.873x873uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Sarah Gibson Tuttle of Olive and June says we can expect to see metallics continue to dominate our feeds. \"Everything from warm rose gold to icy platinum,\" she predicts. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576006184043-main.1080x1350uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Celebrity crystal manicurist Mazz Hanna agrees, predicting we'll see a variety of different hues with pearly metallic finishes. \"It's been a while since frosty colors have been on trend, so I predict this making a comeback in a big way.\" </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img to its \"undeniably young and fun spirit.\" Eva Chen, pictured above, sported a bright yellow Jin Soon shade for the 2019 Met Gala. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576084936044-main.1500x1500uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img going to be big. \"It's a shade that people weren't comfortable wearing for a long time, and they're just now realizing that it's an extremely universally flattering shade that gets tons of compliments.\" </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img in a sage, sunny yellow, and pinky lavender mood,\" she explains. \"Adding a higher concentration of white into shades really makes the color pop.\" </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576009063159-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img natural progression of the latest '90s craze,\" she explains.\"Think Hard Candy–inspired colors with glossy topcoats.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img typical corals that Varnish Lane clients gravitate toward in the spring. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img 2020 because we already see this color becoming more popular for nails,\" says Dunne. Jin Soon Choi agrees, noting that blue is definitely an It color for next year.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576009082367-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576085073560-main.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I used various nudes during the 2020 fashion week shows for Tibi, Phillip Lim, Alexander Wang, Coach, and Longchamp,\" recalls Choi. She recommends experimenting by using nude alone, nude/ombre, and nude in a matte finish for a cool spin on the nude trend.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img different color on each finger as seen during several recent fashion shows.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img that people will turn to their tips to support their political views,\" says Hanna. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img design trend transition from a different shade on every finger to a more subtle two or three shade ombré,\" explains Tuttle. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img suspects we'll be seeing even more minimalistic designs as the year continues. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576274760188-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img swipes of metallics into our manis,\" says Tuttle. This is a clever way to complement your favorite ring stacks. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576002354680-main.800x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576002496949-main.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption>This is not your grandmother's French manicure! \"For 2020, instead of a traditional crescent, we'll see new tip styles such as heart shapes, double Frenches, and asymmetrical placement,\" says Tuttle. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576005206286-main.1080x1346uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Hannah agrees, noting that we should expect to see more variations in the tip color and width of line work on the nail tip as pictured above.  </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576085770269-main.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Choi concurs, sharing, \"Simple nail art, such as tweaked versions of French manicures and halfway negative space, confetti, and one big dot on each finger will be popular.\" A lot of artists used this modern style of French nail art during the NYFW S/S 20, as seen above at the Rag & Bone show.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576002584981-main.800x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576002909340-main.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Tuttle says she is looking forward to applying color theory to create more nuanced and custom colors. \"We'll see the layering of polishes to give even more dimensionality to shades,\" she explains. Try layering a metallic under a barely there sheen for a subtle glow from within that works year-round. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576003086133-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576003262329-main.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Creating products that really work is a priority across the beauty business this year. Tuttle shares that the Olive & June team is working on a few new treatments and looking forward to creating even more products that are truly innovative (like its patented universal polish bottle handle, pictured above) in the coming decade. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576009108080-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576006895977-main.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Hanna is super excited about Orly's Builder in a Bottle product, which she says has totally changed the nail extension game. \"It makes gel nail extensions super easy, which is great because it's a much healthier alternative to toxic acrylics.\" </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576009115112-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576086013875-main.828x828uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Poly gel is the latest nail tech invention that has caught Choi's eye. \"It's a breakthrough nail enhancement that can be applied as an overlay or used to sculpt a full set of nails,\" she explains. \"The enhanced formula delivers strong, flexible, feather-light nails—it is astonishingly light on clients yet stronger than hard gels,\" she raves.  Additionally, Choi predicts that gel nail stickers with fun colors and designs will continue to grow in popularity, longevity, and shine as seen above on Choi's client. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576086508388-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/284306/nail-trends-2020-284306-1576004513064-main.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption>When it comes to the biggest trend in nail care, Varnish Lane is already leading the way. The Washington, D.C.–based salons are setting the standard for waterless nail care. By eliminating water, a main source of infection when getting a manicure, they have created a much safer service for clients. Additionally, when hands and feet are soaked in water, they become waterlogged and are not able to absorb any other moisturizing products. Furthermore, nails also expand in water, which causes polish to chip prematurely. If all of this isn't convincing enough, waterless manicures save up to 15 gallons of water per service, making it much more environmentally friendly than the traditional treatment.  Saving the planet's water supply one manicure at a time? That's something we can all support. </figcaption></figure></p><p><em>Up next: These are the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-opi-nail-colors\" target=\"_blank\">best OPI nail colors</a>, period.</em></p><p><em>This article was originally published at an earlier date and has been updated.</em></p><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/4XBTewRvYlI\" height=\"1\" src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288254/summer-to-fall-dresses-288254-1595024460768-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p class=\"p1\">As we fast approach August and dare I say—the end of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/bike-shorts-trend-2019\" target=\"_blank\">summer</a>—we’re starting to slowly think about the invigorating change of season ahead. Yep, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/net-a-porter-sale-best-fall-trends\" target=\"_blank\">fall </a>is just around the corner and my shopping <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-under-100-fashion-july-2020\" target=\"_blank\">cart</a> is already starting to reflect its arrival—most notably in my <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/cheap-cute-summer-dresses\" target=\"_blank\">dress</a> choices. As I look to invest in some effortless <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-brands-for-dresses\" target=\"_blank\">dresses</a> that I can wear right now in the balmy summer heat, I'm <em>also</em> thinking-forward to what frocks will easily transition into fall. </p><p class=\"p1\">When shopping for summer-to-fall transitional dresses think about versatile color palettes and bold <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/floral-dresses-for-summer\" target=\"_blank\">floral prints</a> that can conveniently be worn in both seasons. Think of details such as <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/puff-sleeve-outfits\" target=\"_blank\">puff-sleeves</a> that continue to trend this season and into the next. Look for dress silhouettes that can easily shift into Autumn with the right layers and a great pair of boots.</p><p class=\"p1\">Below, we’re sharing some of the most stylish and noteworthy summer Buy","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/_BYKgGlvQtE/grunge-trend-fall-2020","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288672/grunge-trend-fall-2020-288672-1597861028514-image.1200x900uc.gif\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>It is common to see flannels and chunky boots trending during <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/basics-styling\" target=\"_blank\">fall</a>, but this time around, it was the styling of said items that birthed the undeniable grunge aesthetic. The '90s look has worked its way back into the wardrobes of fashion gils everywhere over the past couple of years, but all of those nostalgic comebacks finally came to a head this season on the runways. Thanks to brands like R13, Monse, and even Burberry, we have enough inspiration to start assembling grunge looks of our own this fall. </p><p>Ahead, you'll get to gaze upon some of the grungiest looks that came down the F/W 20 runways. Including plaid pieces, platform boots, chain chokers, safety pins, and more, the selection ahead will provide you with the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-2020-shopping\" target=\"_blank\">ultimate shopping picks</a> plus a few styling tips along the way. </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288672/grunge-trend-fall-2020-288672-1597770276998-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The grunge aesthetic really emphasizes that dark-flannel look, and we love how Burberry mixed two different hues and plaids in this outfit. Worn over more delicate silky pieces, such as a slip dress, this look feels so fresh for fall. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288672/grunge-trend-fall-2020-288672-1597728216314-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288672/grunge-trend-fall-2020-288672-1597724306976-main.2000x3001uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288672/grunge-trend-fall-2020-288672-1597725282224-main.888x1110uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288672/grunge-trend-fall-2020-288672-1597726664662-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288672/grunge-trend-fall-2020-288672-1597770282951-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Repeat after me: chains, safety pins, and belts. These three details will make or break your attempt at achieving the grunge vibe. Even if you're wearing a simple black suit, the addition of a chunky chain choker and an edgy belt will instantly transform your look. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/242063/best-white-sneakers-242063-1597961135823-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>By now, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/how-to-wear-converse-sneakers\" target=\"_blank\">classic white sneakers</a> have graduated from a street style-inspired trend to a <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/classic-wardrobe-basics\" target=\"_blank\">wardrobe classic</a>. You can find the once of-the-moment shoe style at nearly every brand now in a range of textures, unique stitching, slightly different shapes, and a variety of price points. The sneakers are a must for every woman’s shoe collection (no matter one’s personal style) since the sneaks are so versatile you can wear the kicks with just about anything. Today we’re sharing the top options from a variety of brands so you can find just the right pair for your fall wardrobe. Whether you style the sneakers with a <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-dress-with-sneakers-outfits\" target=\"_blank\">pretty printed dress</a> or opt for a laid-back look like jeans and a T-shirt or leggings and cozy hoodie, there’s sure to become your go-to shoes (if they aren’t already).</p><p>Shop our edit of the best white sneakers below.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288697/nike-affiliate-story-288697-1597943800855-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>So, I'd be lying if I said I was keeping up with that well-thought-out workout plan I came up with at the beginning of stay-at-home orders. I've become a little too comfortable with doing the, well, bare minimum to keep me semi in shape.</p><p>That was until a good friend of mine (who also happens to be a health coach) recommended I check out <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=m8L28pJerk7IHAlwUeCcPLOPYauBbMcLKPMEMb4RenP8s9LMlPY8Fe7ZgRNo_eLumO72WbjxA_load6jb-rfagiuSjBa88PfAzDgYnE8A-7_AMZUt68\" target=\"_blank\">Nike</a>'s latest drop of insanely cute new arrivals. Within seconds of scrolling the site, my motivation to get myself on my mat and logged into that Zoom pilates class I've been RSVPing \"maybe\" to for months skyrocketed. Now, I can't wait to show off my chic leggings, bright sports bras, and (my personal favorite) fresh sneakers to all my friends online—and on a side note, I'm super impressed by how many Nike items come in a really inclusive range of sizing. Looking for a little inspiration yourself? By","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/cEMAuEr7X8k/best-high-waisted-yoga-shorts","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288747/best-high-waisted-yoga-shorts-288747-1598038059754-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p class=\"p1\">Whether you practice <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-yoga-leggings\" target=\"_blank\">yoga</a> a lot, dabble in it here and there, or you're thinking of starting it up, wearing a comfortable outfit is key to allow you to flow through your yoga poses properly and reap the physical and mental benefits it has to offer.</p><p class=\"p1\">While we may all have a trusty pair of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-leggings-review\" target=\"_blank\">leggings</a> in our closet that we reach for when practicing yoga, today we're honing in on <strong>yoga shorts, </strong>an excellent alternative to <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-black-yoga-pants\" target=\"_blank\">yoga pants</a> that allow you to move freely, check your body alignment easily, and are ideal for practicing hot yoga.</p><p class=\"p1\">Yoga shorts (or clothes for that matter) don’t need to expensive. The most important part is that they're comfortable, stretchable and that they fit your body just right.</p><p class=\"p1\">So what are the best yoga shorts out there? We tapped into L.A.-based yoga instructor <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=wtsNqyS9V0sjbPHdneJLc6A-LYBXnzXK4nfK0AF-WChNXYrEADUwHCs4LA8n0dXVQMSodx6P\" target=\"_blank\">Rebecca Watson</a>, who practices asana five days a week and meditation daily to share the yoga shorts she loves and swears by. 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"8 Things We Don't Know If We'll Ever Wear Again Post-Quarantine","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/tVuaIQbi33w/quarantine-style","description":"<p>Anyone else feel like your entire life, and subsequently, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/summer-basics-wardrobe\" target=\"_blank\">wardrobe</a>, changed overnight when Covid-19 lockdowns began months ago? As time marches on, we all find ourselves adapting more and more to our new (for the time being, at least) low-key way of life, and even though seemingly everything is canceled these days, we don't want to just stop looking cute. But we also don't see much of a need for the restrictive and dressy pieces we <em>used</em> to wear. (Remember \"night out\" clothes?)</p><p>Ask any one of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/stylish-fashion-items\" target=\"_blank\">our editors</a> and the number one thing they look for in an article of clothing or an outfit these days is comfort. Personally speaking, it just doesn't feel right to be uncomfortable when at home or going to the grocery store, for example. Curious as to what fashion items my fellow editors have removed from their wardrobes (maybe for good), I made them tell me. In doing so, we've also made room for some new wardrobe categories to expand in our closets. Keep scrolling for all the intel and to shop items that are relevant to our changed lives.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666498857-main.1024x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Impractical heels—or really, any shoes are that hard to walk in—feel completely irrelevant to me now after having prioritized all things comfortable for so long. I'll be saying goodbye to tall heels and favoring shoes with a mid-height heel instead when I want a little bit of lift.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666921305-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666573961-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666578839-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666506591-main.1024x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"While I don't think I'll ever truly quit tailored blazers, I'll definitely be wearing loose, comfortable styles instead of more fitted versions. It's the easiest way to get away with wearing a T-shirt every day and still look polished TBH.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666578130-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666577265-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666580129-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666511235-main.1024x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Rigid Skinny Jeans won't be a priority for me anymore. Instead, I'll be opting for stretchier skinnies when I'm not wearing my go-to joggers and sweat shorts.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666576216-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666576599-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666576996-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666515702-main.1024x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"Never say never, but I'm not sure I need to mess with underwire bras ever again. I find plenty of support in soft styles, and after so many months going sans bra, I'm not sure I can muster up the courage to strap into a wire device again.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666573481-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666575228-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666574387-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666521570-main.1024x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I was never very keen on wearing tight dresses, but I'm really over them now. There are plenty of pretty dresses out that that you can actually breathe in, like this Dôen one, so why bother with anything else?\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666572023-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666571356-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666573042-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666526870-main.1024x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I don't think I've put on a pair of jeans since March, but in my \"pre-quar\" days, I used to love wearing the tightest, most rigid styles and sizes possible. While I know I'll get back into wearing jeans eventually, I think I'll pay more attention to comfort when shopping for denim in the future.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666580514-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666577716-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666579107-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666532134-main.1024x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I never say never, but I highly doubt I’ll ever wear heels over 3 inches anymore. Throughout quarantine, I’ve been so used to wearing comfy sneakers, sporty sandals, and my Birkenstocks that it’ll be hard to arch my feet into anything else!\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666579667-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666575649-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666572741-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288514/quarantine-style-288514-1596666536850-main.1024x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I hate to say this, but I feel I must retire my leather pants for the time being. They will definitely be the first item to make it's way back into my wardrobe when the time is right, but for now, they just don't make sense, even once fall hits. Instead, I'm gravitating toward sleek but cozy pants that look polished but feel like pajamas.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img Fall","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/_RCvXPiqwxk/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1598048699890-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Even though it's hot and humid out as I sit down to write this, I don't think it's ever too early to start conjuring a fall wardrobe, even if that means just mentally (for now). Colder and crisper weather will be here before we know it and since it's our job to inform you of the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-style-guide\" target=\"_blank\">most stylish options</a> the season has to offer, we're doing just that, only with a comfortable twist.</p><p>With many people continuing to learn and work remotely well into the fall, it's only fitting that we look at this season's batch of trends through the lens of comfort and practicality (without sacrificing style, of course). Looking to the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/comfortable-fall-trends/\" target=\"_blank\">F/W 2020 runways</a> and what our fashion friends are wearing IRL, we've surmised that the following six comfortable fall fashion trends will reign supreme. From the new loungewear staples everyone is wearing to the dress trend that couldn't be any better suited to 2020, continue on to discover and shop our ultimate comfy fall edit.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1598048100107-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Fitted knit numbers flooded the fall runways, most notably at Dion Lee, Simon Miller, and Brandon Maxwell where the snug dresses were alluring but surprisingly comfy-looking, too.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1597973718223-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img season is bringing a massive wave of relief to our feet as droves of designers are offering classic boots with flat (and platform) soles made for lots of walking.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img Big, boxy blazers continue to stay relevant season after season and as long as they're in style, we'll be talking about them. Thanks to the retro sporty aesthetic that's on the rise, crewneck sweatshirts are gaining steam and, well, they're literally made for lounging. That said, they work just as well with leggings as they do layered over a collared shirt or styled with a tennis skirt for a trendier take.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1598048388301-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1598048370005-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1598048370421-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1598048459668-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1598048494262-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288678/comfortable-fall-fashion-trends-288678-1598048897297-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I know it's still August, but we'll have to think about outerwear eventually and when we do, hairy shearling and fuzzy faux fur will be top of mind. Jeans","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/XcuMGpnozTw/cute-outfits-with-jeans","description":"<p>There’s no such thing as outfit inspiration overload when it comes to styling your go-to skinny jeans. They’re a classic style that <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-jean-trends\" target=\"_blank\">we recommend everyone have in their closet</a>. With their high waist and flattering fit, skinny jeans are a <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/types-of-jeans\" target=\"_blank\">denim shape</a> that’s stood the test of time and passing trends. They’re timeless for a reason—<a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-skinny-jeans-according-to-editors/slide14\" target=\"_blank\">Who What Wear editors all agree</a>.</p><p>So, to ensure you’re squared away with a fresh set of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/denim-trends-2019\" target=\"_blank\">denim outfit combinations</a> this fall, we’ve rounded up 20 new ways to wear your skinny jeans. From the season’s most popular denim-and-blazer look to a few interesting ways to layer sweaters, turtlenecks, and more, here’s how to wear your most flattering jeans over the next few months. Get inspired below, and be sure to show us how you’re wearing skinny jeans this fall with the hashtag <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=Hg7HLUl3uKRZwUGu5SQO7x1jPNYE0NGAlEiCOBIqB9tqRQRS7TrFARFElB_CJcOeLDyD4R-ryZ7_7yMlzUrmB6LpG7aqtg\" target=\"_blank\">#WhoWhatWearing</a>.</p><p>Keep reading to see which 20 cute outfits to with jeans we feel are especially fresh right now.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/242088/cute-outfits-with-jeans-242088-1533677251768-image.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>You can't go wrong with denim-on-denim.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/242088/cute-outfits-with-jeans-242088-1598043232160-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/242088/cute-outfits-with-jeans-242088-1567044475495-image.2581x3872uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Black jeans are as versatile as they come. October","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/UdRhvYkT_JA/ugg-ultra-mini-boots","description":"<p>It's probably been a minute since you wore—or even thought about—<a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/uggs-outfit-ideas\" target=\"_blank\">Ugg boots</a>, but September is upon us which means that so is Ugg season, and model Joan Smalls is getting a head start. She was photographed in New York this week, debuting a brand-new pair of Uggs that I predict will be the new \"It\" style: the Classic Ultra Mini Boots. </p><p>The boots are a new, updated iteration of the Classic Mini that everyone already knows and loves (proven by the over-2k reviews they have on <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-nordstrom-shoes-on-sale\" target=\"_blank\">Nordstrom</a>), but this new style is decidedly more subtle, with an even lower shaft. They come in the ever-popular Chestnut and Black Suede hues, a couple of other neutrals, and the wild card color: hot pink. If you're in the market for a new pair of Uggs, we recommend ordering them ASAP. They're sure to fly out of stock (it's already happening at <a /cdn64@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-14-12-129_fe4fd1aad3c6f956.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288756/ugg-ultra-mini-boots-288756-1598048721375-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn30@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-13-27-015_106053fb71950a6f.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288756/ugg-ultra-mini-boots-288756-1598048774554-main.1660x1783uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn90@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-21-082_c542f28e4151c797.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288756/ugg-ultra-mini-boots-288756-1598049056051-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn56@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-14-12-028_91c123858008ddaa.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288756/ugg-ultra-mini-boots-288756-1598115852346-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn70@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-03-281_e761ea3687ccc9aa.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288756/ugg-ultra-mini-boots-288756-1598048785821-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn72@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-59-370_8221d4c5c77e75e7.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288756/ugg-ultra-mini-boots-288756-1598048804737-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn90@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-23-415_c20dced1d6750b7a.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288756/ugg-ultra-mini-boots-288756-1598048830440-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn26@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-32-751_963dce2a9836e6a5.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/UdRhvYkT_JA":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn70@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-14-222_d0cf56dc4c7babef.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598321581863},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"20,000 People Ordered This Damage-Erasing Serum in a Single Day—So We Tried It","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/NWfucqHg7So/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/283496/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound-283496-1572629362417-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I'll start by saying this: If we were to cover the launch of every single new product to hit the beauty market—or even just the buzzy products—we'd be chained to our laptops 24/7 and would likely perish from starvation, dehydration, and so on and so forth before even making a dent. The skincare industry is an extremely saturated market, and while part of our job description is covering and reviewing every vile, tube, and tincture that's percolating excitement, we reserve our one-off reviews for budding brands and debut formulas boasting internet-breaking potential. For instance, U Beauty. The brainchild of skin-obsessed Tina Craig (who you might also know as Bag Snob), U Beauty is the only brand in the world steeped with Siren Capsule Technology. What is that, you ask? In short, it's glorious, patent-pending molecules strategically designed to draw complexion-wrecking damage away from healthy skin. (Feels a little Back to the Future in the best way possible, no?) Essentially, U Beauty and its hero Resurfacing Compound is impeccably smart skincare, and not surprisingly, the serum did practically break the internet when it became available for pre-sale back in October of 2019, receiving more than 20,000 orders in roughly 24 hours.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/283496/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound-283496-1572629368336-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Clean, vegan, non-GMO, cruelty-free, and formulated sans fillers, U Beauty's Resurfacing Compound is not only a game-changing and exciting new serum, but it also has some lofty claims. For instance, beauty lovers such as Chriselle Lim have gone on record stating the serum slashed her normal skincare routine in half, and the brand states that the key ingredients are so multitasking you can actually kick all of your other serums—such as vitamin C and hyaluronic acid—to the curb. In addition to its famed Siren Capsule Technology, the Compound's genetic makeup consists of other complexion heavy-hitters like antioxidants, retinol, and vitamins C and E.  Since it comes with such outstanding claims and easy-peasy application—you apply two to three pumps to just-cleansed skin before a moisturizer both morning and night—my fellow beauty editor Courtney Higgs and I had to try it. Ahead, we're diving into our skin types, our biggest skin concerns, and what exactly U Beauty's ultra-buzzy Resurfacing Compound did to our faces. Plus, we took some bare-faced selfies for photographic evidence. Keep scrolling!</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/283496/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound-283496-1572629373286-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/283496/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound-283496-1572629379252-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Skin type: combination, sensitive. Skin concerns: uneven skin tone, hyperpigmentation, dullness. When I first caught wind of Tina Craig's new skincare line, I was pumped for two reasons. First off, I've followed the OG fashion blogger since college, so this honestly felt like celebrating the accomplishment of an old friend. Second, Craig has impossibly good skin, so I was eager to see what trade secrets she’d be sharing from her access to the best, most cutting-edge skincare pros in the game. All that said, I’ve spent a long time perfecting my multistep skincare routine, so the lofty claims that U Beauty is meant to replace almost every step was a bit of a shock. It’s EU-compliant, dermatologist-tested, safe for all skin types, clean, vegan, cruelty-free, and as effective as toners, serums, and moisturizers combined. What kind of sorcery is at play here? While I can’t speak to any mystical goings-on inside this bottle, what I can say is that after a few days of using U Beauty product morning and night, I’m starting to see some shifts, the most notable being how glassy my skin is when I wake up in the morning. The formula is a lightweight gel, spreads easily, and quickly dries down to a taut shield on the skin. While I like the visible tightening effect of using the product on its own, I’ll admit that I have not abandoned my favorite hyaluronic acid serum or my lightweight moisturizer to round out my regimen. But it does seem that adding U Beauty to the mix has definitely contributed to my skin’s current glow. Only time will tell, but I’ve got a couple of dark marks from a small breakout I had recently I’m hoping this formula will combat.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/283496/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound-283496-1572629386422-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/283496/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound-283496-1572629392135-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/283496/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound-283496-1572629396637-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Skin type: combination, sensitive, acne-prone. Skin concerns: acne/acne scars, dryness, redness, dullness. I'm always the first to admit that when a product sounds too good to be true, I immediately crinkle my forehead in doubt. Made in Italy, safe for every skin type and tone, patent-pending, clean, vegan, cruelty-free, and equipped with wizard-like brightening, resurfacing, renewing, tightening, and equalizing powers? There had to be a catch. Not to mention Craig's Resurfacing Compound can supposedly replace my collection of serums and toners and work said magic in as little as three to six days? Fat chance, I couldn't help muttering to myself. Alas, I stand a bit corrected. I will say that I have been using the Resurfacing Compound for about four days now, morning and night, and haven't seen any type of miraculous changes in my skin. But I'm pretty sure it has lightened some acne scarring, smoothed my overall skin texture (I had received a very extraction-heavy facial just a couple of days before this photo was taken), and brightened up my skin tone. The formula hasn't clogged my pores or irritated my skin, which is more than I can say for other serums containing vitamin C and retinol I've tried in the past. So that's honestly a huge win right there. The first time I tried this serum I'll admit I was a bit taken aback at how lightweight it is. I was expecting it to be lightweight, but it almost felt like air on my skin. Can this actually work? I wondered. The brand recommends applying one to two pumps to the entire face after you cleanse, but I found three to four pumps were required to cover the ground I needed to. That said, it did spread like a dream, and it absorbed almost instantaneously. I have an extremely minimal skincare regimen right now—just cleanser, maybe toner, moisturizer, and eye cream, so this was actually adding a step for me. However, thanks to how lightweight and easy it is to layer, I barely noticed, and my skin didn't feel like it was being suffocated with products. I need to be honest and say I was hoping the compound would do a little more work in the realm of hydration (I've been drier than normal when I wake up in the morning), but I also know that's par for the course when using any kind of retinol-containing formula. Only time will tell if U Beauty's Resurfacing Compound continues to work all the magic it's alleged to, but so far, so good, and other than that slight bit of dryness, I have zero complaints.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/283496/u-beauty-resurfacing-compound-283496-1572629415704-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><em>Up next: <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/sunday-riley-ice-ceramide-moisturizing-cream-review\" target=\"_blank\">Everyone's Talking About Sunday Riley's Newest Launch—Here's Our Verdict</a>.</em></p><p><em>This article was originally published at an earlier date and has been updated.</em></p><img src=\"http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/NWfucqHg7So\" height=\"1\" 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"I Asked 8 French Women to Spill the Contents of Their Beauty Vanities","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/mq7NZL0Xqwk/french-beauty-secrets","description":"<p>I don't hide my love and admiration for all things <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/garance-dore-beauty-secrets\" target=\"_blank\">French</a>. I blame my stint studying abroad for this, and I would say a significant portion of the 1139 people I follow on Instagram are either from or based in France. From <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/french-haircare-routines\" target=\"_blank\">hairstylists</a> and <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/french-skincare-and-makeup-routine\" target=\"_blank\">makeup artists</a> to influencers, designers, and models, I'm constantly looking to my favorite French women for inspiration. Not surprisingly, I always walk away with some fresh beauty or fashion wisdom. Whether it's a new <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-micellar-waters\" target=\"_blank\">product recommendation</a> or simply an extra skincare practice I want to incorporate into my regimen, I love immersing myself anyway I can.</p><p>Even though a minimalist, less-is-more approach is usually associated with the <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/the-best-french-beauty-products\" target=\"_blank\">French beauty aesthetic</a>, that assumption isn't always accurate. In fact, some of my favorite French women actually stand for quite the opposite—eyelids loaded with glitter, lips saturated with gloss and ruby-red… There's far more to \"French beauty\" than Brigitte Bardot–inspired fringe or no-makeup makeup. So in seeking some beauty inspiration (because when am I not?), I reached out to eight ultra-chic French women to find out their most cherished beauty must-haves (aka, the items they always keep tucked inside their bags or on top of their vanities). They're spilling all the tea below, so keep scrolling!</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288612/french-beauty-secrets-288612-1597782880848-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288612/french-beauty-secrets-288612-1597783088027-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I am obsessed with this toner. It's such a satisfying feeling.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288612/french-beauty-secrets-288612-1597783094579-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I can't live without lip balm, so I used to buy Homeoplasmine. I feel sexy the instant I spritz it on.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288612/french-beauty-secrets-288612-1597783003830-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288612/french-beauty-secrets-288612-1597783798782-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"This is my all-time favorite. I've been using it for years, and I can't get enough! This spray is great to use, especially during summer, with or without makeup. It gives your skin a glow, refreshes your makeup, and it smells pretty amazing. It also tightens the appearance of pores. It's my first step after washing my face, and I also use it during the day whenever I feel like I need to refresh my skin.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288612/french-beauty-secrets-288612-1597783864259-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"This is the perfume I wear most often and have had the longest. Every time I wear it, people around me always ask me about it. It smells like joy, freedom. It's super fresh and has peony, essential rose, cocoa bean, and musk!\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288612/french-beauty-secrets-288612-1597783878793-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I'm always looking to nourish and hydrate my skin as much as possible, and I've been obsessed with this skin butter ever since I first tried it. It not only makes my skin significantly softer, but it also gives it a beautiful shine and glow. It's what I use before going to the beach or when I'm taking pictures showing lots of skin. It gives my skin the radiance I need.\"</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288612/french-beauty-secrets-288612-1597783891823-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>\"I live for face oils! Sneakers","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/vQszqN9pWkk/how-to-style-air-jordans","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597945816526-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Let me clarify something: when I say \"all of a sudden\" what I really mean is that I've been watching this <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/jeans-and-sneaker-outfits\" target=\"_blank\">sneaker trend</a> bubble up for a while now and it's finally reached a point where it feels like <em>everyone</em> is wearing them. Well, not literally every single person, but enough that it feels quite relevant. You know what I mean.</p><p>So with that, the sneakers that seem to be having a moment in vogue right now are none other than Nike's <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/nike-jordan-womens\" target=\"_blank\">Air Jordan 1</a>. Just like the many of the popular sneakers of the moment (we're looking at you, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/summer-sneakers\" target=\"_blank\">Reebok and New Balance</a>), these iconic high-top kicks are far from new—in fact, their history goes back to 1985 and, of course, their namesake Michael Jordan. (I highly recommend watching Jordan's docuseries <em>The Last Dance</em> on Netflix for the full backstory).</p><p>So why are they popular again now? Their flat-soled, high-top shape lend a retro appeal that feels especially cool right now, but more importantly, the brand has been releasing updated Air Jordan 1's in fresh new color options—and fashion girls have been all over them. We've cataloged the best ways to style Air Jordans and shopped out each looks below.</p><p><figure><img
