/02-13-03-588_f3484f4945041667.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948050397-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn31@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-46-939_58a9784ed345644f.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948109899-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn62@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-24-744_5e1363ca5bb70b83.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597947989380-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn86@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-40-479_3b89d63716d94c85.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597949532269-main.850x967uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn82@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-14-27-777_88906149fc2c4cc3.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597934933712-image.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn37@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-22-268_1d9fa3852c5cacb9.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948338970-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn22@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-07-159_abfaa0f3ba719366.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948590895-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn54@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-25-802_cd4bcfcab6df8c03.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948928623-main.850x967uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn36@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-54-005_da5618039654a22e.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597934936465-image.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn64@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-56-820_9d84653b61b8de0a.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948410183-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn42@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-14-28-073_57c8350ca07c4a16.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948500591-main.1128x2000uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn37@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-14-27-410_80a5ca590fe5e79a.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597949640950-main.850x967uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn72@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-14-06-303_10d16e4f5daff6a4.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597877251402-image.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn88@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-14-09-096_100fbf597b116493.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948824073-main.850x967uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn75@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-54-249_e7191d3982a1845a.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597948672068-main.800x0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn86@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-14-19-105_6bef26b228d35841.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288679/how-to-style-air-jordans-288679-1597949713523-main.850x967uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn69@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-13-34-013_d4003ec3ae1d5e02.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/vQszqN9pWkk":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn56@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-14-25-509_3a5a70c0bccb95d6.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598321581914},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"The Emerging Trend in Jewelry That's Actually Affordable ","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/lQVvFQZawIo/demi-fine-jewelry-brands","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938371794-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption>As minute as it may be, one of my biggest grievances is when jewelry I’ve just bought begins to tarnish or irritates my skin, creating a not-so-cute rash. But what’s a girl to do when she’s not ready to splurge on fine jewelry but is over cheap jewelry? The solution lies in the industry's budding demi-fine market. For the past few years, there’s been an explosion of demi-fine brands creating pieces that bridge the gap between costume and high-end jewelry.  What exactly classifies a jewelry brand as demi-fine? Typically with fine jewelry, you see pieces made out of precious stones and metals with larger price tags, while costume jewelry uses metal alloys and has prices below $100. Demi-fine jewelry merges these two mediums by creating pieces made with gold (below 18 karats) and silver or plated pieces paired with semi-precious stones, hitting that sweet spot under $400. The result? A rising class of demi-fine jewelry brands that have taken over our Instagram feeds.  If you haven’t seen the demi-fine jewelry brands in your feed yet, don’t fret, because we’ve rounded up 18 that have been leading the charge in making finer jewelry far more accessible. Keep reading to find some hidden gems.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938395310-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>When I think of brands that carved out the demi-fine jewelry space in the industry, I think of Missoma. While it may seem this brand is new to the scene, as it’s gained popularity on Instagram recently, don’t be fooled. Marisa Hordern actually founded Missoma in London back in 2008. The brand’s rise in the cultural zeitgeist can be attributed in part to fans like Meghan Markle and Kaia Gerber, but what really makes this brand one to watch (and shop) is the fact that it creates 18-karat-gold and silver-plated pieces that are perfect for stacking and mixing and matching with your other favorite jewelry pieces for everyday wear. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938421402-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938430046-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The first time I saw a pair of Maria Black earrings, I audibly gasped. Founded by Copenhagen-born Black, this jewelry brand specializes in sculptural jewelry pieces both in the demi-fine and fine markets. So wherever you are in your jewelry collection phase— whether you only have $50 dollars to spend or $500—you can find a well-crafted piece of jewelry that can leave you just as breathless as I was. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938450628-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938460071-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Cuchara means \"spoon\" in Tagalog, which seems like a random name for a demi-fine jewelry brand but makes complete sense for the evolution of how Edilou Cañedo founded her brand. What originally started as a passion for collecting vintage spoons and silverware turned into the foundational base of metalwork that makes Cuchara’s jewelry so special. Based out of Toronto, the brand has both an affordable and demi-fine line composed of various fine metals to create a hybrid of pieces inspired by '90s pop culture and nature itself. Basically, every piece of jewelry is like uncovering something beautiful from the past. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938482664-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938507849-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Fine jewelry isn’t the only way you can get unique pieces that tell a story. In fact, the demi-fine jewelry brand Alighieri’s story originates in founder Rosh Mahtani’s love for literature. Instead of taking the “typical” route of getting into the jewelry world, Mahtani studied literature at Oxford, where she became enamored with Dante Alighieri’s Divine Comedy. This infatuation is what led her to create her demi-fine jewelry brand in 2014. Not only does every piece embody the imperfections and wanderlust of Dante’s story, but this award-winning jewelry brand’s pieces are thoughtfully made with ethically sourced metals produced by craftsmen in London. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938516118-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938524263-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>When thinking about jewelry, affordability is an important aspect, but it’s not the only thing we should be focusing on as consumers. While fine jewelry may last a lifetime, the implications from the mining industry can be alarming—which is a big part of the thought process behind Vancouver-based brand Wolf Circus. Founded by Fiona Morrison, the brand utilizes recycled sterling silver and bronze pieces that are triple plated in 14-karat gold as a more sustainable demi-fine jewelry option. Not can you feel good about where your jewelry piece comes from, but with prices starting under $100, the brand is the epitome of attainable and sustainable luxury. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938534350-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939590298-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Who said that demi-fine jewelry had to focus on gold and silver pieces primarily? In fact, one of the things that distinguish demi-fine jewelry definitively from costume and fine jewelry is its ability to meld different materials to create out-of-this-world pieces—and no other brand is doing that quite like Ejing Zhang. The brand was founded in 2015 by London-based Chinese designer Zhang, and her work has become lauded by fashion girls for its quirky incorporation of resin into the designs. The result is pieces any jewelry collector would be ecstatic to own.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938584894-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938679422-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>What happens when two sisters of Trinidadian and Mauritian lineage living in East London decide to start a business? You get the demi-fine jewelry brand Stellar 79. What makes this jewelry brand unique is that the two founders bring their life experiences to the jewelry-making process. Each piece adheres to ethical guidelines around sourcing gemstones and metals and is handmade by artisans in Jaipur, India. In addition to putting tremendous thought into the production process, Stellar 79 also donates to Educate Girls, a nonprofit organization helping underprivileged girls in rural India gain an education. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938750421-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938756628-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Great jewelry can come from anywhere, but it just so happens that F+H Jewellry is produced in small batches in Australia’s Byron Bay. Jewelry has long been a boys' club, but Byron-based female founder Sharona Harris set out to change the jewelry space in 2014. The brand is female-owned and -designed, and the pieces are meant to strike the perfect balance between traditionally “feminine” and “masculine” design aspects. The results? Minimal yet edgy pieces that can be worn every day. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938776246-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938785592-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>What began as a commerce platform to curate lifestyle brands for Wald Berlin founders Dana Roski and Joyce Binneboese morphed into their very own demi-fine jewelry collection. But this isn’t just another jewelry brand. From ensuring every piece is handmade by a collective of women who formerly struggled with employment to partnering with German biologists to ensure the pearls and corals used in each piece are not on the protected-species list, every jewelry piece created by Wald Berlin is crafted with the utmost thought. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938793798-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938807288-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>By now you're probably wondering, Are most demi-fine brands internationally based? And while a lot of the jewelry brands that lead the charge in creating the demi-fine market are abroad, there are some U.S.-based jewelry companies worth putting on your radar—such as Forge & Finish. Founded by Desiree Casimiro, Emily Kane, and Carly Mayer in Philadelphia, these women are putting their love for jewelry and metalworking skills to good use by using jewelry to bring awareness to community issues.  For example, with the launch of their most recent collection, they’ve partnered with Clean Water Action to raise awareness and funds around supplying clean-water accessibility to generations to come. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938818622-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938827700-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>If you’re a Nordstrom fanatic, then you’re going to want to put Argento Vivo on your radar. Not only does the brand partner with one of our favorite retailers to create accessible finer jewelry at affordable prices, but it also prides itself on its ability to create trend-forward pieces made out of the best-sourced sterling silver to help you curate a collection you can love for a lifetime. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938836540-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938845702-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Whoever said great jewelry had to be expensive never knew about Stella and Bow. Founded in 2014 by former stylist Lauren Brokaw, Stella and Bow has become a favorite among celebrities like Meghan Markle and Chrissy Teigen because of its easy-to-style, dainty pieces ranging from demi-fine to fine in terms of the karat count and stones used. But beyond creating fashion-forward finer pieces, what makes Stella and Bow so special is its commitment to philanthropy. The brand regularly collaborates with nonprofit organizations to donate a portion of its proceeds. Basically, investing in a piece from Stella and Bow is something you can feel good about in all senses.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938899757-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938912232-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>While the materials that make a Laura Lombardi jewelry piece may be precious, recycled metals, the pieces themselves are anything but dainty. Founded in 2010, the Brooklyn-based demi-fine jewelry brand melds founder Lombardi’s Italian and New York roots into bold ’80s-inspired chunky pieces. Since its inception, the brand has been a favorite among fashion girls and even the likes of Tracee Ellis Ross—so that should tell you everything you need to know.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938925740-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938935307-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I’ve professed my love for Éliou before, and I’ll do it once again. Founded by Cristina Mantilla and Duda Teixeira, this contemporary and kitschy demi-fine jewelry brand specializes in creating pieces with cowrie shells, freshwater pearls, and glass beads. Since every Éliou piece is made to order, you get one-of-a-kind pieces. Basically, it’s the same feeling as investing in a piece of fine jewelry without the hefty price tag. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938957068-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938965864-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Costume jewelry is in many ways seen as accessible not only because of its price point but also because of its ability to adapt to current trends. But there are ways to stay trendy and still invest in great jewelry. Enter Martha Calvo. Founded in Miami in 2006, the demi-fine jewelry brand specializes in fun, 14-karat-gold-plated jewelry with unique designs featuring fruit charms, freshwater pearls, and personalized elements. The result is a collection that melds contemporary style with timeless metals. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938984095-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938994327-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The best jewelry tends to have an air of magic to it, and the demi-fine jewelry brand Pamela Love fits the bill. Founded in 2006, it draws inspiration from early Mexican and American silverwork, along with mysticism, folklore, astronomy, astrology, and alchemy. To make each piece even more magical, they’re manufactured in the founder's Brooklyn-based studio, unless a piece requires a specific skill set, which she tentatively outsources with thought. Basically, every Pamela Love piece is made with a little bit of precious metal, a little bit of magic, and a little bit of love. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939570232-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939229233-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The fine-jewelry space has long had its issues with sourcing ethically made materials, but the demi-fine, Black-owned jewelry brand Omi Woods is aiming to change that. Founded by Ashley Alexis McFarlane, the brand has a mission to create handmade pieces ranging from vermeil to 24-karat with fair-trade African gold and globally sourced, conflict-free fine metals. With each collection, McFarlane not only taps into her Jamaican Ashanti Maroon heritage to inspire the pieces but also ensures the artists receive fair wages. Basically, you can rest assured that an Omi Woods piece supports Black artistry now and will last for generations to come.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939348060-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939011421-main.850x1275uc.jpg\"><figcaption>If you’ve made it this far, you’re well aware of the fact that the demi-fine jewelry market has been booming, and there are so many more jewelry brands to look forward to, such as Uncommon James, which is set to launch its first-ever demi-fine collection on September 10 with real, ethically sourced, round-cut diamonds around the $200 price point. </figcaption></figure></p><p><em><strong><span>Next:</span><a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-instagram-jewelry-boutiques\"><span> I Work in Social Media, and These Are My Favorite Jewelry Accounts to Follow</span></a></strong></em></p><img 8/25/02-14-23-759_8b0b4b05abcbde46.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938965864-main.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn78@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-39-950_3ae93b0182b4a44b.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938984095-main.850x967uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn61@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-27-289_3317ad8c197efc9a.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597938994327-main.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn44@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-13-03-616_b3da40fe798b65e9.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939570232-main.850x967uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn68@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-46-491_b01a1cfcc7dae307.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939229233-main.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn33@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-21-338_587a9c237724f608.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939348060-main.850x967uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn95@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-13-45-946_45b9046a4e814060.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288717/demi-fine-jewelry-brands-288717-1597939011421-main.850x1275uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn19@2020_5/2020/08/25/02-14-10-149_a3d52631380c8c48.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/lQVvFQZawIo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn100@2020_4/2020/08/25/02-13-57-030_4ee936b1efea722b.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598321581913},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"25 Hairstyles That Look Ridiculously Chic With Wispy Bangs","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/4xwR3UD2AVY/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs","description":"<p>We're <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-bangs-for-your-face-shape\" target=\"_blank\">huge fans of bangs</a> here at Who What Wear, and we've been loving all the iterations of the style that have been making a major comeback—baby bangs (think teensy-tiny micro-fringe), side-swept bangs, blunt-cut bangs, long and layered bangs, fake bangs, and last but not least, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/long-bang-haircut\" target=\"_blank\">wispy bangs</a>. Another thing we love? Not everyone wears, or heck, even defines wispy bangs the same. Length and chunkiness can vary as can the infinite number of fringe-flattering styles you can wear to complement said cut. </p><p>Below, we're highlighting 25 different hairstyles that look ridiculously chic paired with wispy bangs, no matter how long, short, thick, or thin your strands are. Plus, not only are we providing <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/celebrity-new-haircut\" target=\"_blank\">ample celeb-led inspiration</a> for your current bang situation, but we're also including the must-have styling product or accessory to accompany each vibe. Keep scrolling!  </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458296894-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Lucy Hale has been working her signature chin-grazing bob for a while now (we love it), and we're super into this faux-pixie look her longtime hairstylist Kristin Ess created. Uninspired by your wispy bangs? Pump up the volume and give yourself a combover. The effect is so damn cool. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458731328-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458304937-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Even though model Maria Borges is working a super-short length, her ultra-cropped fringe is an exemplary styling option for wispy bangs paired with a chic pixie cut. A glossy hair wax is essential for that perfectly piecey texture. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458726165-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458312948-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The \"Lord Farquaad\" hairstyle has been a trending theme for 2020. Usually, we see it sans bangs, but Zooey Deschanel pairs her signature fringe with the fun, flipped-in look, proving just how versatile it is. Make sure you have a big round brush handy to nail that curve. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458719819-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458321676-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Joan Smalls can do no wrong in our book. We love this triple-hit hairstyle featuring her natural curls, eye-grazing fringe, and '90s-inspired clip-back. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1596743231501-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458334923-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Looking for the ultimate French girl–inspired fringe? Jeanne Damas is our forever muse. (Oh, and in case you're wondering how French women always seem to have impossibly perfect style, read this deep dive.)</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458708987-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458349898-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Ever the hair chameleon, Jourdan Dunn is constantly thrilling us with her hair vibe. That said, if you have wispy bangs, don't underestimate the power of a chic chignon at the nape of your neck. Elevate it even further by leaving a few longer tendrils around your face.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458703868-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458357667-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Dakota Johnson proves a messy topknot (kept elegant with all the shine) is another viable styling option for wispy bangs. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458696619-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458371782-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Duckie Thot pairs her long, luxe, glossy length with statement-making wispy bangs. We're obsessed. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458688194-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458380932-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Suki Waterhouse is known for her retro fringe. Here, she demonstrates how to keep a wispy fray off of your face (if you so choose).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458680779-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458391837-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Like it or not, the mullet is one of this season's top hair trends, and Miley Cyrus (wispy bangs and all) executes the controversial style with A+ finesse.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1596743866938-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458398712-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Wispy, grown-out bags look so sophisticated in conjunction with a glossy low ponytail. (Just ask Shay Mitchell.) </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458668812-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458406708-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>From mullets to bowl cuts, Zendaya has done (and slayed) it all. Here, she pairs some choppy wispy bangs with a blunt lob cut right at the collarbone. Try an iron for a similar mussed curl style.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458663194-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458417110-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>We're used to seeing model Shanina Shaik with a straight-and-glossy blowout, so this refreshing look with wispy curls framing her face is a welcome change. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458655476-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458424376-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Use a hair straightener and shine serum to smooth out wispy bangs and creat the trendy tendril updo everyone (including Jasmine Sanders) is making cool again. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458649171-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458430980-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Michelle Williams is always the picture of elegance. We've seen her dabble in the wispy-bang trend back when she had a shorter Peter Pan cut, but now that her length and bangs have grown out a bit, we love the Old Hollywood glamour of finger waves to keep her fringe out of her face. A flexible-hold hair spray will definitely be your friend with this style. The below from Leonor Greyl will leave a soft and silky finish.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458644372-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458452654-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>For the ultimate Brigitte Bardot–meets–Françoise Hardy look, style your wispy bangs à la Felicity Jones's stunning half-up moment. Lots of volume is key here. If your hair is on the fine side, beef it up from the get-go by opting for a volume-enhancing shampoo and conditioner pre-style. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458638694-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458459491-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Side-swept fringe and lots of curls are especially chic if you have a shorter cut like Nina Dobrev's. If you think you're curl-inept, the Beachwaver will completely change your life. It literally curls your hair on its own with the press of a button!</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458633118-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458469858-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>If you haven't thoroughly stalked Kat Graham, please do so at your earliest convenience. She's living proof that short and chic bangs never cease as the ultimate style accessory. This pins-and-pony style, in particular, is a standout.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458626261-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458477382-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>And just like that, Kerry Washington convinced us to get a pixie cut. (Wispy bangs included, obviously.)</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458616091-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458494112-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Styling wispy bangs need not be complicated. Pull them out front and secure your hair into a bouncy high pony for a chic result that's one-two-step approved. (Oh, and add a scrunchie if you want to take it up a notch.)</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458607508-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458500834-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Nope, Halle Berry didn't pair her wispy bangs with a mullet, but this double-twisted bun style is definitely a business in the front, party in the back vibe we're very much into. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458505585-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458601315-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458527084-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Braids—they're the ultimate styling antidote to any bad hair day or strand-related dilemma. The below oil from Shu Uemura packs extra nutrition into the style while delivering glorious luster like in Lea Michele's take. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458591118-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458535329-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Stumped or bored with your fringe? We have one word for you: headbands.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458587420-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458546613-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Rashida Jones shortened her hair recently, and the new style makes her signature wispy bangs look all the fresher. Make sure you have a shine-inducing blow-dryer handy to nail that at-home blowout. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458580886-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458554693-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>If you're having one of those inevitable days in which you don't actually want to deal with your bangs, take a page from Constance Wu's book and just slick it all back. Chic, easy, and you won't have to worry about fussing with your fringe all day.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458575610-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458561656-main.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption>They're something so cool about short, eye-grazing bangs with super-long, layered hair. Heidi Klum, we see you. </figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458570009-main.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Up next: The Best Bangs for Every Face Shape, According to a Celebrity Hairstylist. 30980-main.1200x1365uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn22@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-37-836_204437f9caafea59.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458644372-main.1200x1200uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn3@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-14-08-321_850189ac5f9b4a28.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458452654-main.1200x1365uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn82@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-06-755_d411ab52594f6212.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458638694-main.1200x1200uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn84@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-14-04-040_d183c4fab557c1da.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458459491-main.1200x1365uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn59@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-14-09-791_9d986fd8ac059003.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458633118-main.1200x1200uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn5@2020_6/2020/08/25/02-13-31-858_654ccdec81d8840e.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458469858-main.1200x1365uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn9@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-35-112_7b8060fe0289bdf1.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458626261-main.1200x1200uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn30@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-16-355_806b011fa5786382.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458477382-main.1200x1365uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn5@2020_2/2020/08/25/02-13-35-911_19ba1f9ec5f9985a.webp","https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/286654/hairstyles-for-wispy-bangs-286654-1586458616091-main.1200x1200uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn94@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-14-13-262_7ab6 Fancy","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/Vth26mTJTis/best-lace-underwear","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287619/best-lace-underwear-287619-1591378072720-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Let's talk <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/types-of-lingerie\" target=\"_blank\">lingerie trends</a>. Currently on deck for 2020 are a few fresh styles I'm personally excited about, like the comeback of boy shorts and boxers. But if <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/classic-summer-style\" target=\"_blank\">classic staples</a> are more your speed or you're just curious about the lingerie items that will stand the test of time, look no further than lace pieces. Lace lingerie, but specifically lace underwear, is one of those items I'm convinced will never go \"out\" no matter how many trend reports may come and go. It's more of a basic, but a delightful and delicate basic at that.</p><p>Right now, I'm all about updating those \"<a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-trendy-basics\" target=\"_blank\">special basics\"</a> throughout my closet. I have my eye on a number of pretty lace pieces that I think will make great additions to my top drawer. The only hitch is that there are a dizzying amount of options out there. Search \"lace underwear\" into any retailer's search bar and I guarantee you'll be flooded with a ton of hits, so I'm streamlining the process and highlighting the prettiest pieces in every underwear type from thongs to briefs to boyshorts. Scroll down to shop the best lace underwear in every category.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287619/best-lace-underwear-287619-1591373688059-image.1200x1365uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287619/best-lace-underwear-287619-1591370920345-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Hanky Panky's signature thong comes in a ton of color options, but you can't go wrong with beige.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/287619/best-lace-underwear-287619-1591371248506-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption>FYI, each thong is just $3.60 in this multi-pack. Set","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/EUO2bbePJOA/free-people-loungewear-sets","description":"<p>Speaking from someone who doesn't have \"boho\" style, I get that it's easy to assume that all you'll find at <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/popular-free-people-clothing\" target=\"_blank\">Free People</a> is loose maxi dresses, tie-dye, and crochet cardigans, but I'm here to tell you that's far from the truth. The brand's inventory is <em>vast</em>. I could delve into that, but I'm here to talk about one specific category: <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=d2m4BZ7Dz2I6cNc8T9a-0kFNuIhnZFnfhhaTSYOn9KyWLLgm_a71_XnL5oJ9N_-iFs_d8WcWMQEg0M28a_tdJDZbBuJQlRaRnkjfP7RJS4MjcQOwxIq9gZvlrUcrNxW-FDtwNcWx2_c1pTgaErRFUrczgtPckzUDnWe-ZdgDCw\" target=\"_blank\">loungewear sets</a> (most of which are also suitable for outside-the-house activities).</p><p>As you know, the biggest overarching trend of 2020 is <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/comfortable-summer-outfits\" target=\"_blank\">comfort</a>, but we're not all suddenly going to cease caring about looking stylish. Enter loungewear sets. They provide the aforementioned comfort combined with just enough polish and style, and Free People has lots of them. Some feature shorts, some pants, and some even skirts or dresses. There's something for everyone, so even if Free People's aesthetic doesn't really align with yours, you might want to take a look.</p><p>Scroll on for the best 15 (out of 100) loungewear sets at Free src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288625/simple-fall-trends-288625-1597346635771-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>I’m personally not that big of a fan of “tricky trends.” You know, those trends that just seem <em>complicated</em>—whether it’s that they don’t pair easily with go-to basics like jeans or appear to be uncomfortable and not so versatile. If you’re with me, what's coming your way could be particularly intriguing to you. Yep, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/fall-shopping-staples\" target=\"_blank\">fall 2020</a> actually hosts a variety of <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/easy-fashion-trends\" target=\"_blank\">simple trends</a> that are actually quite easy to style.</p><p>Essentially, the looks in question could inherently just style themselves and make a fashion-forward statement with minimal effort aside from potentially having to mix in a few basics. I’m talking about items like eye-catching knit dresses, directional tailoring, and so on. Keep scrolling to check out these six uncomplicated fall trends, complete with a bit of visual inspiration. You’ll also find shopping recommendations as well if you’re interested in getting a jump-start on building out your wardrobe.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288625/simple-fall-trends-288625-1597346843971-image.850x872uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The beauty of leather and faux-leather separates is that they add a directional element to an ensemble. You basically need nothing more than an A+ pair of shoes for an instantly-chic outfit.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288625/simple-fall-trends-288625-1597433405683-product.800x0uc.png\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288625/simple-fall-trends-288625-1597425160521-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288625/simple-fall-trends-288625-1597425239735-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288625/simple-fall-trends-288625-1597420728964-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288625/simple-fall-trends-288625-1597346843368-image.1080x1080uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Chunky black boots are practical and of-the-moment. 0uc.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn47@2020_3/2020/08/25/02-13-59-138_f68f582d0939320d.webp","http://feeds.feedburner.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~4/ssrWayglCNo":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn37@2020_1/2020/08/25/02-14-22-873_622301e66dab6983.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598321581863},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"Gwyneth Paltrow's Makeup Artist Told Us the Mistake Women Over 40 Always Make","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/1Lq94TiAD5Y/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560190167697-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-anti-aging-serums\" target=\"_blank\">Life after 40</a> rules: You're no longer humming with insecurities you might have experienced in your 20s and 30s; you're generally more settled and comfortable in your own skin. Speaking of skin, though, figuring out how to adjust your skincare routine is one area that might require a bit more consideration.</p><p>By the time we turn 40, we start to notice lines around the mouth, the forehead, and the eyes, and our makeup often begins to just sit differently on our faces. But modifying our makeup bags and our routines to suit our new needs is easier said than done. We're not all professional makeup artists, after all, and<strong> figuring out the ideal products and techniques to use on aging skin can be seriously challenging</strong>.</p><p>Fortunately, we have the perfect celebrity makeup artist to help navigate. Enter: <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=eBgYcI9N8LFa22Gpqb1y9UeQ_w8lWDY1tyvZmq0bkOVzbWMZecHsCAyIE2Wn26PtwdURIORsGPspSZHr\" target=\"_blank\">Jamie Greenberg</a>, a Hollywood makeup artist whose handiwork can be found on the likes of age 40–plus icons like <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/makeup-products-for-women-over-40\" target=\"_blank\">Gwyneth Paltrow</a>, Rashida Jones, Chelsea Handler, Maya Rudolph, Lauren Graham, and Julie Bowen. Greenberg is also the creator of <a class=\"link link--story\" href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=eT3EDFgzDs8ieSIWauQXgjYB8P3Twwydtp_Ht2yHrWRPnQvF8WB34mEuQxLaXggDtehb\" target=\"_blank\">J<span class=\"il\">amie'</span>s Swag Bag</a>, a monthly box of curated makeup and skincare finds.</p><p>We asked Greenberg to share some of the most common makeup mistakes she sees women over 40 making—plus a few tricks that will instantly up your makeup game. Keep scrolling to see her tips.</p><p>No matter how skilled you are, the best makeup in the world can still look dull and cakey without healthy skin underneath. Take it from Greenberg who says she sees a lot of women over 40 expect their makeup to do all the work for them.</p><p>\"Many women don't hydrate or have a full skincare regimen,\" she says. \"I highly suggest finding products that feed your skin. <strong>It's imperative so that <span class=\"gmail-il\">makeup</span> can look more natural on the skin.</strong>\"</p><p>Dehydration and fine lines and wrinkles are often the key <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/celebrity-skincare-products-mature-skin\" target=\"_blank\">concerns for aging skin</a> (though everyone's skin type and issues are different). Below, check out a basic skincare routine to try if you want to plump and de-wrinkle your skin without <em>too</em> much effort.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210858808-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210859724-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210860104-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210861164-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1562688709495-main.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Poorly blended foundation looks wonky on everyone, but it's especially obvious on more mature skin. \"<strong>Many women haphazardly schmear on foundation with their hands, and often miss spots or create lines of demarcation</strong>,\" says Jamie. \"It's so important to take your time and put it on evenly.\"</p><p>Instead of slapping on foundation with your fingers, try a thick foundation brush, like the Rodial <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=UZPod1BmbiHVUPQqtL4_ETkZz7Q-seqH5cn-vOHmxlSkFihyMf7a1lRXE5hSFFv8AHwVd9cVrGIKT0CWgLJDSKTQe0VgBbQOnxD9r-_umpYsr6K0wvrEqhuQ2PZYzGww-k0E_2Hkm258HuOhoxRYM_EnrNPG0xJGxEiDlZVuCEWff648jtXRVHhc4HWv31WUh9PbSxB1pJzWBgRfi_rqFYKpW74EWZqgmvUGcJx8tHRZXoEVu7Cfhl9Tcd8IUVO6MaS-52IxaVFb0tBJ6t6g0AvYf5nt2nN_Qn7Ljp1kyT0x5E0C7vJpRkrNvyUQ6fJUCG5qombzxxU1XfJvpn1wxjT4sdIldW58uC9wvivN2nOuce5hsfbeuULWSO9wCCnHMz_7g09ZNxp9XcskFoUxiWdN6cX5kFVjGaTxtAVqCwLma_BRaw3AX6rEmyfW11fEe1bC35XC9MY9sTR7eSDUTial\" target=\"_blank\">The Airbrush Foundation Brush</a> ($55) or EcoTools <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=t0RuJFsaVDloo1ef1MMt70A4dMdFmf8E-b_zpvewQyKbJuZAzAjwn9mz3YR10-O-o7QM7K8bVrXV\" target=\"_blank\">Wonder Cover Complexion Brush</a> ($9) or—Jamie's favorite—a classic <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=ci8c9lD9PqLxf6sLrfTf4Nt4UjdZmK8rXtVmGf5jtOqI6XPhrdBdsXT41tkRNJVyPtUKLfYi99kK\" target=\"_blank\">Beautyblender</a> (don't forget to dampen it) for flawless application.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210934831-product.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210935116-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210935361-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>What happens when you get so accustomed to the look and products you've been using since college? One day you wake up, it's 20 years later, you're on the last stub of a very old lipstick, and your whole look is super dated.</p><p>\"We don't keep the same clothes or wear the same thing every day. The same thing goes for skincare and <span class=\"gmail-il\">makeup,\" says Greenberg.</span> \"If it's old, throw it out.\" Greenberg says she has friends who've had pans of eye shadow for 10 years or more. \"Not only is that unsanitary, but it also looks bad on the skin,\" she says. \"I'm all for a signature style, but it's fun to switch things up.\"</p><p>It doesn't have to be a total overhaul. Make a simple change! For example, <strong>try navy liner instead of black, a coral lip instead of nude, or a dewy foundation instead of matte. Experiment with filling in your brows with a fiber-rich gel instead of a waxy pencil, or even go for colored mascara.</strong> \"Little changes make a big difference,\" Greenberg says.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210956772-product.1440x1920uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210957625-product.3840x3840uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210962916-product.1000x1000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560210963628-product.1150x1150uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1597965502095-main.850x967uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>It sounds so simple, but Greenberg says learning to curl your lashes is a must if you don't do it already. <strong>It's a really simple, instant way to look more bright-eyed and energetic</strong>, as if the past two decades simply never happened. Shu Uemura's iconic <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=b-6YV2hcTIFu7FDeVK9PIm7Lrp7ava_zBhtb4Oy8lcU4l1NZaRupvHTCNGRUoEC6Y82bCnUMXpHy5bGJll_aYPevN7mWHvzsyrWEADItdSo82RCOwdzpqgaDKaNPt12lx4XozjFNk7h-PaPxRuQhA2lMjXEmL2jc4uGjfBR8QNlZNQV2xtqSB2tSZkiTv85xBlh_eHHXxv_K7Xb9_KXeLRTWPptq92Va-b9n8mEDkSGzScQ-ALI4h4XYC-_XTy7-WBSeexJMbFnT5_1GzjQOcoGSGOyTKOLem5vAiJBbr8JYSfCckSnYt9zM_pCQvvP5fMcGjDirLZ6UrdziKJgo91AO3M8Cp0mV_p7ll6iEabnUdrq9jvrWxnW_RrlZzZ3dwI2QRjiowAWWnl3QmUKU1rjZQOgqydyAsz6mFpJpMHkzPT39pf52nlgREch94q00SwgADUe4rCaoS-D8dTjUxI1qRgGUmAOxdmvRymJHntD5Ks34VJT5qsvZK2982W61ZrCQBuUU_shYNfWBDcewKm7xqX8O9D9Pp3vEMyZs2Oeej8bq9IdnCnSQ7bs_hpBv2Mgjie_qZ_OAIvoeM04GEQeBmzBRkOLt06qkoY4LC_GciOg9BAvdNJ45C9-C5Y4wc6rHuE-M_Rk\" target=\"_blank\">lash curler</a> makes the process totally goof-proof.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211062670-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211063438-product.1150x1150uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211064208-product.1920x1920uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-eye-creams\" target=\"_blank\">Dark circles and bags</a> under the eyes are concerns for almost everyone over 40. And while concealer works like a Band-Aid, <strong>treating your under-eyes with products formulated with active ingredients like caffeine, peptides, and chemical exfoliators will make your makeup look even better.</strong> \"Eye masks are a weekly occurrence for me that make such a difference,\" says Greenberg. \"Do them while you do your hair for a special event or if you feel tired. It's a game changer!\" Pro tip: Keep your eyecare products in the refrigerator so that when you apply them, the coolness will work to depuff any bags.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211237948-product.1000x1000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211239544-product.1560x1960uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211243360-product.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211239416-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211244223-product.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p>Not a makeup tip in the classic sense, but according to Greenberg, a flattering haircut, style, and color can do twice the work makeup can do. And <strong>try doing your hair <em>before</em> your makeup—that'll make the process less stressful.</strong> \"Hair can take away a lot of the anxiety on the face. When I do my hair, <span class=\"gmail-il\">makeup</span> is so much easier!\" Greenberg says.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211358275-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1560211359010-product.800x0uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/280456/makeup-tips-for-women-over-40-280456-1597965966310-main.1128x2000uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><em>Next up: Don't miss the<a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-lengthening-mascaras\" target=\"_blank\"> lengthening mascaras</a> that will trick people into thinking you have lash extensions.</em></p><p><em>This story was 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"I'm Small-Chested and Tried on a Ton of Swimwear—These 6 Styles Fit the Best","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/-ONEEprrwyE/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts","description":"<p>Over here in sunny Los Angeles, it feels like summer may never end, which, for the record, I'm not the least bit mad about. Since I anticipate months more of beach days, I'm still shopping for some <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/cheap-bikini-sets\" target=\"_blank\">new bikinis</a> to add to my rotation. But not just any bikinis—I'm looking for ones that best suit my smaller-sized chest.</p><p>While my cup size may fluctuate throughout the month (anyone else?), I'm usually a solid 34B. There are certain styles I've found that really don't look the best on my smaller chest, like straight-across bandeau tops and high-neck swimsuits. I strongly stand by the statement \"every body is a bikini body;\" however, I personally feel most confident in a swimsuit when the fabric isn't swallowing up my top half. There are six styles, in particular, I find best highlight my smaller boobs. Shop them, ranked from <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/floss-bikini-trend\" target=\"_blank\">the most revealing styles</a> to least, below.</p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531758851-image.1200x1598uc.jpg\"><figcaption>It might be a stretch to say string bikinis are universally flattering, but they are beloved by many women with many body types. I find the string halter top to hug in all the right places and provide almost a boob-job effect. Yes, I said it.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1596579000489-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Broderie Hipster Bikini Bottom ($23).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531762109-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531761632-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Peixoto Toni Bottoms ($66).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595541906865-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531758499-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Floral Bikini Bottom ($30).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531756466-image.1200x1598uc.jpg\"><figcaption>The classic triangle top is the slightly more modest version of the string halter top above. Because the cups don't slide around, this style is definitely a safer bet for swimming and other activities that involve getting up from your towel. Look for one that has adjustable straps in the back, like this Monday Swimwear suit, to really hug everything in.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531765403-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Barbados Bottom ($77).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531768793-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Brazilian Bikini Bottoms ($18).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531760098-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Twisted String Bikini Bottoms ($75).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531771563-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Finelines Brief Bikini Bottoms ($54).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1596580963668-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531757254-image.1200x1598uc.jpg\"><figcaption>I've always found demi-cup bras and swimsuits to fit my friends with larger busts much better than they do me. My friend Lauren proved me wrong (once again, sigh!) when she suggested I try a top style dubbed as the mermaid bikini. The difference is subtle but important: There's a separation between the two cups that creates a slightly more angled effect—perfect for showing just a touch of cleavage without going overboard.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531762792-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Susana Rib Bottom ($90).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531760647-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Toiny Leopard-Print High-Rise Bikini Briefs ($90).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531768119-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Ander Bottom ($80).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1596579167303-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching High Waist Bikini Bottom ($23).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531761138-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Graphic-Print High-Rise Bikini Briefs ($85).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531755182-image.1200x1598uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Standard bandeau tops that are essentially a rectangle shape always make me feel like an adolescent boy. I'm sorry, but it's true. I can't really fill them out, so they end up looking more like a strapless top. Instead, I've found bandeaus that sort of pinch in at the center, with either a ring or a tie, provide a little bit more of a shape. Bonus points if you find one that also comes with removable straps!</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531764643-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching High Rise Bikini Bottoms ($92).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531756599-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Grace Belted Floral-Print Bikini Briefs ($150).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1596579447524-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Aubrey Bottoms ($75).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531757696-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Antibes Scalloped Stretch-Crepe Bikini Briefs ($144).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531772222-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Echo Printed Bikini Bottom ($106).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531757894-image.1200x1598uc.jpg\"><figcaption>When I want something with a little more coverage, I like to wear a crop top–style bikini. Now I'll admit, this style is ideal for my dream life, in which I'm hanging out on a yacht every weekend as opposed to my apartment's tiny pool. It's definitely really good at being pretty and not so good at being practical, and I am 100% okay with that.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531755924-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Amber Bottom ($110).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1596580313679-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Gio Bottom ($90).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531767332-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Sweetie Pie Bottom ($78).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531770534-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Chelsea Bikini Bottoms ($78).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531766723-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Laila High Waist Bottom ($100).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531754309-image.1200x1598uc.jpg\"><figcaption>All summer I've been really into one-shoulder tops, regularly wearing them with jeans and linen shorts. I can't believe it took me so long to discover one-shoulder bikini tops because I am now their number one fan. The style offers fuller coverage but looks more flattering, in my opinion, than a straight-across top. This one, in particular, is made with a sustainable fabric, which I am equally as excited about.</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595531769522-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching Monica Bottom ($90).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288334/best-swimsuits-for-small-busts-288334-1595541311342-product.1200x1200uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Shop the matching ($90).</figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img 10:13:01","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 10:13:01","title":"How Sarah Sherman Samuel Found Her Creative Stride in All Things Interiors","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/NuHO6egG0Is/second-life-podcast-sarah-sherman-samuel","description":"<p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-sarah-sherman-samuel-288746-1598232229621-main.1200x900uc.jpg\"><figcaption>Welcome to Second Life, a podcast spotlighting successful women who've made major career changes—and fearlessly mastered the pivot. Hosted by Hillary Kerr, co-founder and chief content officer at Who What Wear, each episode will give you a direct line to women who are game changers in their fields. Subscribe to Second Life on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or anywhere else you listen to stay tuned.</figcaption></figure></p><p><span>Sarah Sherman Samuel is a multidisciplinary designer working with interiors, textiles, objects, and decorative arts, which she curates together to create truly remarkable spaces. Her creativity aligns with her career path in designing spaces for celebrities and tastemakers such as Mandy Moore and Garance Doré and products like wallpaper, rugs, tiles, hardware, and cabinets that give us all access to her unique blended aesthetic. But the road wasn’t always so clear for an artistic spirit who favored many mediums. “I like working on a lot of different creative avenues,” says Sherman Samuel. “By trying all the things, not only do they inform each other, but then I'm also able to see what I truly love doing.”</span></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-sarah-sherman-samuel-288746-1598231732363-main.894x1280uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><strong><span>And try all the things she did. After getting her degree in graphic design, Sherman Samuel took a job at an advertising agency where she mocked up brochures for high-end real estate clients. “The job was awful,” she says with a laugh. But there was something that stuck with her: one of her accounts, the Viceroy Hotel, was designed by none other than interiors legend Kelly Wearstler. “I was so drawn to it that I was like, ‘I want to be doing that,’” she remembers.</span></strong></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-sarah-sherman-samuel-288746-1598231738101-main.982x1280uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><strong><span>Next, she got her first taste of spatial design at a furniture showroom in Miami before moving to L.A., where she worked for a startup fashion paper company designing prints for journals, notebooks, and stationary. Still, though, it wasn’t until Sherman Samuel started her interiors blog that she truly felt she was part of the creative community she had been fondly observing for so long, and in publishing her own home renovations to much fanfare (like her <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=sH-vK9ruo4n3wnPilKi4L4y9OL0BYgNB4YDoBG6jBgYMOGR5A62_hye8I5iZwsr6u_pJ5ssztFEKoKEMGV9trYQJMikQ_is7\" target=\"_blank\">Pinterest-favorite Venice bungalow</a>), she grew her confidence in the interiors space. </span></strong></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-sarah-sherman-samuel-288746-1598277280721-main.989x1280uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><span>But before she put all her eggs in one basket, she once again tested a few more creative passions. From wedding design to freelance photography and art direction to branding work, nothing fueled her fire like working on interiors, both designing spaces and, eventually, creating stunning products to fill them. </span></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-sarah-sherman-samuel-288746-1598231742942-main.958x1326uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><strong><span>When asked about her circuitous route to finding her groove, Sherman Samuel says she wouldn’t change a thing. “How I approach my interiors and product is so informed even by my graphic design degree and every little step along the way. It all came together,” she says. </span></strong></p><p>Head to <a class=\"link link--story\" href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=_moPrGutkqE5Z3e3oIueG4xrACxCeH0oS4h_BBdrq8bkmY9eOl9zgKvD_qzFR3T5GlH-gDGhaQZUzD48iUXKx6hOiENFLSipSyXwVRhD\" target=\"_blank\">Apple Podcasts</a>, <a class=\"link link--story\" href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/ext?tl=w0tzYt2o1un8aZ7iZRbDOMghdvtz0u2aDJ2eadLJ1qJZR5_KavXi25gB2nIb_mXvk0WNYF-2on09M7_v8Z5ooWzyC4M\" target=\"_blank\">Spotify</a>, or anywhere else you listen to subscribe to <em>Second Life</em>, and listen to this brand-new episode to hear about Sherman Samuel's entire career journey. To shop her gorgeous home products, keep scrolling. </p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-kara-sweeney-1-1-288746-1598018468885-main.2000x2600uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-kara-sweeney-1-1-288746-1598018578823-main.2000x2600uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-kara-sweeney-1-1-288746-1598018631521-main.1000x1300uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img src=\"https://cdn.cliqueinc.com/posts/288746/second-life-podcast-kara-sweeney-1-1-288746-1598018308501-main.0x800uc.jpg\"><figcaption></figcaption></figure></p><p><figure><img href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/second-life-podcast-tia-mowry-hardrict\" target=\"_blank\">hear how Tia Mowry-Hardrict went from '90s pop-culture icon to entrepreneur.</a></em></p><img Works","link":"http://feeds.whowhatwear.com/~r/WhoWhatWear/~3/TiU3_PiITRs/hailey-bieber-shorts-boots-outfit","description":"<p>Well folks, <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/hailey-bieber-ripped-jeans-outfit\" target=\"_blank\">Hailey Bieber</a> just outdid herself with this epic anti-quarantine outfit (meaning that her <em>outfit</em> is the opposite of comfy sweats, not that she herself is anti-quarantine, of course). It goes without saying that Hailey Bieber really knows how to step things up with her looks, even when she's just wearing leggings and sneakers. And in this case, even when she's just wearing <a href=\"https://www.whowhatwear.com/best-denim-shorts\" target=\"_blank\">denim shorts</a>.</p><p>Bieber wore so many different It pieces and trends with her Levi's shorts in Beverly Hills this week that I'm almost overwhelmed (in a good way), but let's talk about the shoes first. Instead of something safe such as sneakers or flat sandals, Bieber opted to get a jump start on fall, pairing the short shorts with a pair of new mid-calf boots from celeb-favorite brand By Far. It's a pairing you wouldn't expect to work, but in Bieber's case, it does. Perhaps the Jacquemus blazer and bralette have something to do with it but whatever the case, don't be surprised if you're suddenly tempted to wear denim shorts with boots. Keep scrolling to shop the pieces needed to recreate Bieber's look, just in case you are.</p><p><figure><img
